SourceText: *Tummy Time Safari*
text: *Ixesha loku Lala ngesisu*

SourceText: Time for an adventure - right on the floor! 🌱
text: Ixesha le adventure - kanye emgangathweni! 🌱

SourceText: ✅ Lay a soft blanket on the floor and gently place your baby on their tummy. Put a few colourful toys or soft books just out of reach, and see your baby reach for them.
text: ✅ Yondlala ingubo ethambileyo kanye emgangathweni kwaye ubeke umntwana wakho kancinci ngesisu. Beka izinto zokudlala ezinemibala emihle okanye iincwadi ngaphandle kokufikelela, kwaye ubone umntwana wakho ezam ukuzifumana.

SourceText: 👀 Talk, sing, or lie down face-to-face to keep them engaged.
text: 👀 Thetha, cula, okanye ulale phantsi nijongene ukubagcina bebandakenyekile.

SourceText: 🧸 Make it playful - wiggle a toy or a plastic bottle with some rice like an animal exploring the jungle! “Look, here comes a lion!”
text: 🧸 Yenze kubeyinto yokudlala - yenza ithoyizi okanye ibhotile yeplasitiki ene rayisi ngaphakathi ibengathi sisilwanyana sihlola ihlathi! "Jonga, nantsi isiza ingonyama!"

SourceText: Tummy time is essential for your baby’s physical development and builds the strength they’ll need to crawl and sit ⭐
text: Ixesha loku lala ngesisu lisisiseko kuphuhliso lomzimba kumntwana wakho kwaye kwakha amandla awadingangayo ekukhaseni nase kuhlaleni ⭐

SourceText: *Face to Face Fun*
text: *Ulonwabo lobuso ngobuso*

SourceText: Babies love looking at faces - especially yours! 😃
text: Abantwana bayathanda ukujonga ebusweni - ngakumbi obakho! 😃

SourceText: 👑 Sit comfortably and hold your baby so you’re face-to-face. Make funny faces, raise your eyebrows, puff your cheeks, and talk or sing gently.
text: 👑 Hlala ngokukhululekileyo kwaye bamba umntwana wakho nijongane ubuso ngobuso. Yenza inkangeleko zobuso ezonwabisayo, phakamisa amashiya, khukhumalisa izidlele zakho, kwaye thetha okanye ucule ngokuphantsi.

SourceText: 🚩 Watch as your baby starts to copy you! Peek-a-boo and big smiles are great ways to bond.
text: 🚩 Bukela njengokuba umntwana wakho eqalisa ukukulinganisa! Vala amehlo ngesandla uphinde uvule izandla kwaye unoncumo olukhulu zindlela ezintle zokudibanisa.

SourceText: This activity helps your baby develop emotional connection, eye contact, and early social skills - all while having fun together 🎉
text: Lomdlalo unceda umntwana wakho akhule enemvakalelo ezinxulumeneyo, ukujongana, nezakhono zokuqala zentlalo zonke - ngelixa nizonwabisa kunye 🎉

SourceText: *Sing & Sway*
text: *Cula & Shukuma*

SourceText: 🎵 Hold your baby close and gently sway together to the rhythm of a soft song. You can hum or sing a lullaby as you move, making eye contact and smiling as you go.
text: 🎵 Bamba umntwana wakho kufutshane kwaye ngobunono jikani kunye nilandela isingqi sengoma. Unga hamisha okanye ucule iculo lokulala njengokuba ushukuma, umjonge emehlweni kwaye uncumile njengokuba usenza.

SourceText: 🔄 Try singing the same song each day - it creates a lovely routine and helps your baby recognise familiar sounds over time.
text: 🔄 Zama ukucula ingoma efanayo ntsuku zonke - yakha inkqubo yemihla ngemihla ethandekayo kwaye ikwanceda umntwana wakho akhumbule izandi eziqhelekileyo kumaxesha angaphambili.

SourceText: The soothing movement helps your baby feel safe and connected, while the sound of your voice supports early language development and emotional bonding 💛
text: Intshukumo yokuthomalalisa inceda umntwana wakho azive ekhuselekile kwaye enxulumene, njengokuba isandi selizwi lakho sixhasa ukuphuhlisa ulwimi lokuqala kunye nokudibanisa iimvakalelo 💛

SourceText: It’s a simple, calming way to bond and build your baby’s growing brain through rhythm, movement, and love 🌙
text: Yindlela elula, ezolileyo ukubopha nokwakha ukukhulisa ingqondo yomntwana wakho ngesingqi, iintshukumo, kunye nothando🌙

SourceText: *Toe Tickle Talk*
text: *Intetho yo Nyumbaza Inzwane*

SourceText: Let’s explore toes and fingers with a gentle tickle and some fun words! 👋
text: Masihlole iinzwane kunye neminwe nokunyumbaza ngobunono kunye namazwi athile onwabisayo!👋

SourceText: ▶️ Start by wiggling your baby’s toes or fingers one at a time while counting them, saying your own silly rhyme, or simply naming the toes and fingers: “Tickle your tiny toe!” or “Hello little thumb!”
text: ▶️ Qala ngokujikelezisa iinzwane zomntwana wakho okanye iminwe ngamnye ngexesha njengokuba uyibala, utsho ngesingqi sakho esihlekisayo, okanye ubize iinzwane neminwe ngamagama nje lula: "Nyumbaza uzwane lwakho oluncinci!" okanye "Molo nzwane oluncinci"!

SourceText: This activity strengthens your baby’s awareness of their body and supports early language learning - all while sharing giggles and smiles 🎉
text: Lomdlalo womeleza ulwazi lomntana wakho ngokwemizimba yabo kwaye ukwaxhasa ulwimi lokuqala - konke njengokwabelana ngokugigitheka nangokuncuma 🎉

SourceText: *Follow the Sound*
text: *Landela Isandi*

SourceText: Let’s explore the world of sound! 📻
text: Makhe sihlole ilizwe lezandi! 📻

SourceText: 💡 Find something in your house that makes a gentle sound, like some rice in a packet or a plastic bag.
text: 💡 Fumana into endlini yakho ezakwenza isandi esithambileyo, njenge rayisi ekwi pakethi okanye kwisingxobo seplastiki.

SourceText: 👂 Gently make a sound with the object near your baby’s ear - first on one side, then pause and try the other.
text: 👂 Ngobunono yenza isandi ngento kufutshane nendlebe yomntwana wakho - ukuqala kwelinye icala, kwakhona unqumame kwaye uzame kwelinye icala.

SourceText: 👀 Watch how your baby turns their head to follow the noise. You can even say, “Over here!” as you move the sound.
text: 👀 Bukela indlela umntwana wakho ajika ngayo intloko ukulandela ingxolo. Ungatsho nokutsho uthi, "Ngapha!" njengokuba ushukumisa isandi.

SourceText: This is a lovely, quiet way to play together - and it helps your baby start to understand how sound connects to movement. It supports their attention and brain development 🌱
text: Intle lento, indlela ethuleyo yokudlala kunye - kwaye ikwanceda umntwana wakho aqalise ukuqonda ukuba isandi sinxulumana njani nentshukumo. Ixhasa uhoyo kunye nokukhula kwengqondo yakhe 🌱

SourceText: *Story Cuddles*
text: *Ibali lokuThuthuzela*

SourceText: It’s never too early to share a story! 📖
text: Akuzange kube kwangoko ukwabelana nge bali! 📖

SourceText: 👂 Hold your baby close and tell them a simple story – you can tell them about your day or memories from when you were young, or you can make up a short story.
text: 👂 Bamba umntwana wakho kufutshane kwaye umxelele ibali elilula - ungamxelela malunga nosuku lwakho okanye neenkumbulo ngokuya wawusemncinci, okanye ungaqamba ibali elifutshane.

SourceText: 💙 Your baby may not understand what you are saying yet, but the sound of your voice, your expressions, and the closeness all help them feel safe and connected.
text: 💙 Umntwana wakho angangaqondi ngoku lento uyithethayo, kodwa isandi selizwi lakho, imbonakalo, kunye nokusondela konke kunceda bazive bekhuselekile kwaye benxulumene.

SourceText: 👀 If you share a story from a book, you can point to pictures and describe what you see: “Look, a dog! The dog is playing outside.”
text: 👀 Ukuba wabelana ngebali elise ncwadini, ungakhomba umzobo kwaye uwuchaze: "Jonga, inja! Inja idlala ngaphandle."

SourceText: Story telling builds language, imagination, and a love of stories and reading - right from the start. And cuddling up together makes it even more special ✨
text: Ukubalisa ibali kwakha ulwimi, ukucinga, kunye nothando lwamabali nokufunda - ukusuka kwasekuqaleni. ukubambana kunye kwenza kubaluleke nangaphezulu ✨

SourceText: *Name That Sound*
text: *Chaza eso Sandi*

SourceText: Make everyday noises into a fun game! 🎵
text: Yenza ingxolo yemihla ngemihla ibeyinto eyonwabisayo!🎵

SourceText: 🔑 Use objects like a crinkly bag, keys, or tapping a cup. Make a sound and then pause.
text: 🔑 Yenza izinto ezinjengo shwabanisa isingxobo, okanye ukucofa ikomityi. Yenza isandi kwaye unganqumama.

SourceText: 👂 Say what it is: “Crinkle, crinkle! That’s the bag!” or “Clink clink! That’s the keys!” Watch your baby’s reaction - do they turn toward the sound? Do they smile or blink?
text: 👂 Yitsho ukuba iyintoni: "Shwabanisa, shwabanisa! Eso sisngxobo!" okanye "Khonco khonco! Ezo zizitixo!" Bukela ukuphendula komntwana wakho - Uyajika ajonge ngakwisandi? Ingaba uyancuma okanye utyoba imehlo?

SourceText: This activity builds your baby’s listening and attention skills while helping them begin to link sounds to the world around them.
text: Lomdlalo wakha isakhono sokumamela kunye nesokuhoya kumntwana wakho ngelixa imnceda ukudibanisa izandi kwilizwe eliba ngqongileyo.

SourceText: Even the smallest sounds can open up a big world of discovery! 🌈
text: Kwanesandi esincinci singakwazi ukubavulela ukufumanisa ngelizwe elikhulu! 🌈

SourceText: *Follow the Beat*
text: *Landela iSandi*

SourceText: 🎵 Use your hands to gently clap or pat a simple rhythm on your little one’s legs or arms: “Ta-ta-ta... ta-ta!”
text: 🎵 Sebenzisa izandla zakho ngokuqhwaba ngobunono okanye ucofe isandi esilula kumilenze yomntwana wakho okanye iingalo: "Ta-ta-ta... ta-ta!'!

SourceText: 😃 Then pause and smile - do they respond? Your little one may wiggle, kick, or if they are a bit older they may even copy the rhythm.
text: 😃 Yithi nqumama kwaye uncume - uyaphendula? umntwana wakho angajikeleza, akhabe, okanye ukuba umdalanyana angalinganisa isandi.

SourceText: This playful call-and-response builds listening, rhythm, and connection - just like traditional music has done for generations 💚
text: Lo mdlalo ungamabiza - asabele wakha ukumamela, isandi, kunye nokunxuluma - njenge ngoma yesintu eyayisenza kwisizukulwana 💚

SourceText: *Scarf Peekabo*
text: *Isikhafu se Peekabo*

SourceText: It’s peekaboo time - with a twist! 🎁
text: Lixesha le peekabo - nokujija! 🎁

SourceText: 🔶 Grab a soft scarf or cloth and gently hide your face behind it.
text: 🔶 Thatha isikhafu esithambileyo okanye ilaphu kwaye ufihle ubuso bakho kulo.

SourceText: 👋 Then slowly pull it away and say, “Peekaboo!” with a big smile.
text: 👋 Kanjalo ulisuse kancinci kancinci kwaye uthi, "Peekaboo!" ngolukhulu uncumo.

SourceText: 🧸 Try hiding your baby’s favourite toy or your baby’s feet too. Each reveal is a surprise, sparking joy and curiosity!
text: 🧸 Zama ukufihla itoyi yomntwana wakho ayithandayo okanye iinyawo zomntwana wakho nazo. Ukuzityhila nganye kubangumangaliso, kuvuselela uvuyo kwaye kungumdla!

SourceText: This playful activity encourages visual tracking, helps build anticipation, and supports early social interaction 👀
text: Lo mdlalo ukhuthaza ukulandela umkhondo obonakalayo, inceda ukwakha ukulindela, kwaye ixhasa ukunxibelelana lwentlalo kwangoko 👀

SourceText: Peekaboo is more than just fun - it teaches your baby that things (and people!) still exist, even when they’re out of sight ✨
text: Upeekaboo ingaphezu kokonwabisa nje - ifundisa umntwana wakho loo nto (kunye nabantu!) zisekhona, nokuba xana bengasabonakali ✨

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=trQ1tFuagzQ
text: Ihlengahlengiswe kwi bhokisi yokudlala yakwa UNICEF: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=trQ1tFuagzQ

SourceText: *Mirror Moments*
text: *Imizuzu Yesipili*

SourceText: It’s time to meet someone special - themselves! 👋
text: Lixesha lokudibana nomntu obalulekileyo - ngokwakho! 👋

SourceText: 😃 Stand in front of a mirror or reflecting window with your little one and watch their reaction.
text: 😃 Yima phambi kwesipili okanye kwifestile ebonakalayo kunye nomntwana wakho kwaye ubukele ukuphendula kwakhe.

SourceText: 👀 You can point to their nose or eyes and name them aloud: “There’s your nose!”
text: 👀 Ungakhomba kwimpumlo yakhe okanye amehlo kwaye uzichaze ukhwaze: "Nantsi impumlo yakho!"

SourceText: 🚩 For older babies, encourage them to touch the mirror or make faces. Smile, wave, and copy their movements!
text: 🚩 Kubantwana abadala, ibakhuthaza ukuba babambe isipili okanye batshintshe ubuso. Ncuma, phakamisa isandla, kwaye linganisa iintshukumo zabo!

SourceText: Mirrors support self-awareness, recognition, and early language development - plus, they’re lots of fun! 💙
text: Isipili sixhasa ukuzazi, nokuziqaphela kunye nophuhliso lolwimi kwangoko - ukongeza, kuba kuninzi ukonwaba!💙

SourceText: *Texture Treasure Hunt*
text: *Texture Treasure Hunt*

SourceText: Let’s explore the world through touch! 🌱
text: Makhe sihlole umhlaba ngokuchukumisa! 🌱

SourceText: ✅ Collect safe objects with different textures - like a soft sock, a wooden spoon, a smooth ball, or a crinkly wrapper.
text: ✅ Qokelela izinto ezikhuselekileyo ngemibhalo eyahlukileyo - njenge kawusi ethambileyo, icephe leplanga, ibhola ethambileyo, okanye isisongelo esishwabeneyo.

SourceText: 👋 Gently guide your baby’s hands over each item and describe them: “Soft,” “Bumpy,” “Cold.”
text: 👋 Ngobunono khokela isandla somntwana wakho kwinto nganye kwaye uyichaze: "Thambileyo," "Gqampa," "Banda."

SourceText: 🧸 Encourage older babies to choose what they want to touch. You can even let them sit in or next to a basket with the objects and explore freely.
text: 🧸 Khuthaza abantwana abadala ukuba bakhethe yintoni abafuna ukuyibamba. Ungakwazi nokuba ubavumele bahlale kuyo okanye ecaleni kwebhaskiti enezinto kwaye bahlale ngokhululekileyo.

SourceText: This sensory activity helps develop touch, language, and curiosity - and it’s perfect for quiet bonding time ⭐
text: Umdlalo wokuva unceda ukukhulisa ukubamba, ulwimi, kwaye nomdla - kwaye ulunge kakhulu kwixesha lonxibelelwano elithe cwaka ⭐

SourceText: *Playtime with Books*
text: *Ixesha lokudlala ngeencwadi*

SourceText: Reading to your baby from birth is a beautiful way to bond and support their development - even before they understand the words 📖
text: Ukufundela umntwana wakho kwasesizalweni yindlela entle yokunxulumana kunye nokuxhasa uphuhliso lakhe - nangaphambi kokuba aqondisise amagama 📖

SourceText: ⏰ Choose a quiet moment, turn off distractions like TV and phones, and pick a baby-friendly book or even an old magazine or newspaper you have lying around!
text: ⏰ Khetha umzuzu othe cwaka, cima iziphazamisi ezinjengo mabonakude kunye ne foni, kwaye ukhethe incwadi yobuhlobo yabantwana okanye ingyiyo ne magazine okanye iphepha ndaba onalo oluhleli nje!

SourceText: 💚 Talk about the pictures, make sounds, and repeat simple words. Your baby will love hearing your voice - even if they don’t understand yet.
text: 💚 Thetha malunga nemizobo, yenza izandi, kwaye uphinda phinde amagama alula. Umntwana wakho uzakuthanda ukuva ilizwi lakho - nokuba bangangayiqondi ngoku.

SourceText: Follow their lead - if they lose interest, that’s okay. Keep it short and fun! 😃
text: Landela isikhokelo sabo - ukuba baphulukana nomdla, kulungile. Yigcine imfutshane kwaye yonwabise! 😃

SourceText: 🔄 If possible, start a regular routine to read together when your child isn’t too tired or hungry.Reading together for a few minutes a day is one of the best ways to help your child learn words and connect with you!
text: 🔄 Ukuba kuyenzeka, qalisa inkqubo eqhelekileyo yokufunda xana umntwana wakho engadinwanga okanye engalambanga.Ukufunda kunye imizuzwana embalwa ngosuku ngenye yeendlela ezilungileyo zokunceda umntwana wakho afunde amagama kwaye anxulumane kunye nawe!

SourceText: *Act Out Emotions*
text: *Veza iimvakalelo ngaphandle*

SourceText: Let’s have some fun expressing feelings! 😃
text: Masizonwabise ngokubonakalisa iimvakalelo! 😃

SourceText: 👀 Tell your child, “Let’s see what it looks like when I am happy!”. Act out a happy face and name the emotion again.
text: 👀 Xelela umntwana wakho, "Makhe sibone ukuba ikhangeleka njani xana Ndonwabile!". Bonakalisa ubuso obonwabileyo kwaye uchaze imvakalelo kwakhona.

SourceText: 😔 Then try other emotions, like angry, sad, or surprised. Using a gentle voice, you can explain different reasons why you are feeling that emotion.
text: 😔 Ngoko ke ungazama ezinye iimvakalelo, ezinjengo msindo, ukukhathazeka, okanye ukumangaliseka. Usebenzisa illizwi elizolileyo, ungacacisa ngezizathu ezahlukeneyo ukuba kutheni usebenzisa lo mvakalelo.

SourceText: This isn’t just a game - it’s a chance for your child to learn how to recognize emotions in others 💚
text: Lento ayingo mdlalo nje - lithuba kumntwana wakho ukuba afunde ukuqaphela iimvakalelo nakwabanye abantu 💚

SourceText: By understanding facial expressions, they’ll strengthen their connections with others and develop empathy 💛
text: Ngokuqondisisa imbonakalo yobuso, izokuqinisa unxulumano kunye nabanye kwaye ikhulise uvelwano 💛

SourceText: So, get ready to act out some emotions and enjoy this special play activity together! 🌈
text: Ngoko, lungiselela ukubonisa ezinye imvakalelo kwaye wonwabele lomdlalo ubalulekileyo kunye! 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from I am Safe, Loved, and Learning by Save the Children
text: Ihlengahlengiswe kwa Ndikhuselekile, Ndiyathandwa, kwaye ndiyafunda ngu Save the Children

SourceText: *Animal Sounds & Moves*
text: *Izandi Zezilwanyana & Intshukumo*

SourceText: Let’s roar like a lion or flap like a bird! ⭐
text: Masi gqume njengengonyama okanye phaphazele njenge ntaka!⭐

SourceText: 📖 Show your baby a soft animal toy or picture and say its name: “This is a lion - roooar!”
text: 📖Bonisa umntwana wakho itoyi yesilwanyana ethambileyo okanye umfanekiso kwaye yitsho igama layo: "Le yingonyama - roooar!"

SourceText: 🌱 For younger babies, act it out during tummy time. Older babies might copy your sounds or movements.
text: 🌱 Kubantwana abancinci, zenze ngelixa lexesha lokulala ngesisu. Abantwana abadala bangakwazi ukulinganisa izandi zakho okanye iintshukumo.

SourceText: 👂 Talk to your baby as you play: “The cow says moo!” Pause and wait for their reaction, even a smile or babble.
text: 👂 Thetha nomntwana wakho njengokuba nidlala: "Inkomo ithi moo!" Yithi nqumama kwaye ulinde baphendule, nangoncumo okanye ebhablisha.

SourceText: This gentle game builds language, movement, and bonding – one animal at a time! 💛
text: Lo mdlalo uthambileyo wakha ulwimi, intshukumo, kunye nokudibanisa - isilwanyana ngasinye ngexesha! 💛

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/act-like-an-animal
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/act-like-an-animal

SourceText: *Rolling Ball Fun*
text: *Ukonwaba ngoku Qengqa i Bhola*

SourceText: Time for a rolling game! 🔵
text: Ixesha lomdlalo wokuqengqa! 🔵

SourceText: 👋 Sit facing your child and gently roll a soft ball (or something else round) back and forth between you. Say their name as you pass it: “Here it comes, Sisi!”
text: 👋 Hlala ujongene nomntwana wakho kwaye ngobunono qengqa ibhola ethambileyo (okanye enye into ekhoyo kufutshane) isiya emva kwaye nangaphambili phakathi kwenu. Yitsho igama lakhe njengokuba uyijula: "Nantso isiza, Sisi!"

SourceText: 💛 Cheer them on as they roll it back to you. You can even add a song or count the rolls out loud.
text: 💛 Vuyisana naye njengokuba uyiqengqa uyibuyisela emva kuwe. Ungakwazi nokufaka ingoma okanye ubale njengokuba uyiqengqa ukhwaze.

SourceText: This fun and easy game helps your toddler practise turn-taking, hand-eye coordination, and early social skills - all while enjoying playful connection 🎈
text: Lo mdlalo wonwabisayo kwaye ulula unceda umntwana wakho azame ukutshintshana, ukulungelelaniswa kwamehlo nesandla, kwaye isakhono sentlalo kwangoko - yonke lonto ngelixa nonwabele umdlalo wokunxulumana🎈

SourceText: *Cup Stack Challenge*
text: *Umceli mngeni Wokupakisha Ikomotyi*

SourceText: 🍚 Grab some plastic cups or small containers and show your child how to stack them one by one.
text: 🍚 Qokelela ezinye ikomotyi zeplastiki okanye ezinye izikhongozeli ezincinci kwaye ubonise umntwana wakho ukuba uzipakisha njani phezulu nganye nganye.

SourceText: ⬆️ How high can you build your tower?
text: ⬆️ Kungaphakama kangakanani na ukwakha inqaba yakho?

SourceText: 🎉 Knocking it down is just as fun - watch it fall, then build again!
text: 🎉 Ukuyibetha phantsi kungonwabisa - bukela isiwa, ngoko uphinde uyakhe kwakhona!

SourceText: This playful activity supports fine motor skills, concentration, and problem-solving - and your child will love seeing what happens each time they try 💡
text: Lomdlalo uxhasa isakhono sokusebenzisa iminwe, ingqwalasela, kunye nokusombulula-ingxaki - kwaye umntwana wakho angathanda ukubona oku kusenzeka ngexesha ngalinye ezama 💡

SourceText: *Dance Mirror*
text: *Ukudanisa kwisipili*

SourceText: Let’s get moving and dancing together! ⭐
text: Masishukume sidanise kunye!⭐

SourceText: 👋 Turn on some music or sing a song, and start copying your child’s moves - if they clap, you clap! If they wiggle, you wiggle!
text: 👋 Vula umculo othile okanye ucule ingoma, kwaye uqalise ukulinganisa iintshukumo zomntwana wakho - ukuba bayaqhwaba, qhwaba nawe! Ukuba bayazi bhijabhija, nawe zi bhijabhije!

SourceText: 👀 Then switch and see if they’ll follow your moves.
text: 👀 Emva koko utshintshe kwaye ubone ukuba bazakulandela iintshukumo zakho.

SourceText: This back-and-forth dance helps build confidence, strengthens your bond, and supports early communication skills.
text: Lo mdaniso wokubuya umva nokuya phambili unceda ukwakha ukuzithemba, yomeleza ubudlelwane bakho, kwaye ixhasa izakhono zonxibelelwano kwangethuba.

SourceText: It’s a joyful, silly way to connect through rhythm, music, and play 💚
text: Kuluvuyo, kuyindlela esileyo ukudibanisa isingqi, umculo, nokudlala 💚

SourceText: *Guess the Animal*
text: *Qikelela Isilwanyane*

SourceText: Let’s guess the animal! 🧸
text: Masiqikelele isilwanyane! 🧸

SourceText: 👂 Make a sound like a cow (“moo!”) or a dog (“woof!”) and ask your child, “Which animal is that?”
text: 👂Yenza isandi njenge nkomo ("moo!") okanye inja ("hawu!") kwaye ubuze umntwana wakho, "Sesiphi eso silwanyane?"

SourceText: ⭐ You can point out animals you see, use toys, or just act it out yourself!
text: ⭐ Ungakhomba izilwanyane ozibonayo, sebenzisa iithoyi, okanye uzilinganise ngokwakho!

SourceText: 👀 Then switch and ask them to make the noise - you’ll be surprised how many they know.
text: 👀 Emva koko utshintshe kwaye ubacele ukuba benze loo ngxolo - uya kumangaliswa ukuba zingaphi abazaziyo.

SourceText: This fun game builds memory, language skills, and listening - all through the power of play and imagination ✅
text: Lo mdlalo wonwabisayo wakha inkumbulo, izakhono zolwimi, kunye nokuphulaphula - konke ngamandla okudlala kunye nokucinga ✅

SourceText: *Tap & Shake Band*
text: *Cofa kwaye ushukumise ibhendi*

SourceText: Get ready to make some noise! 🔔
text: Lungiselela ukwenza ingxolo! 🔔

SourceText: 🍚 Gather safe household items - pots, plastic containers, spoons, or sealed bottles with rice or beans.
text: 🍚 Qokelela izinto zasekhaya ezikhuselekileyo - iimbiza, izikhongozelo zeplastiki, amacephe, okanye iibhotile ezivaliweyo ezinerayisi okanye iimbotyi.

SourceText: 👋Show your toddler how to tap, shake, and bang them together to create sounds.
text: 👋Bonisa umntwana wakho indlela yokucofa, hlukuhla, kwaye zibethekise ukwenza izandi.

SourceText: 🎵 Now, make some music and form your own little band! You can sing along or try repeating rhythms together.
text: 🎵 Ngoku, yenza umculo kwaye wenze elakho iqela elincinci! Ningacula kunye okanye nizame ukuphinda izingqisho kunye.

SourceText: This activity builds motor skills, rhythm, and listening skills, and gives your toddler a chance to express themselves through sound and movement! ✨
text: Lo msebenzi wakha izakhono zentshukumo zomzimba, isingqisho, nobuchule bokuphulaphula, kwaye inika umntwana wakho ithuba lokuzibonakalisa ngesandi kunye nentshukumo! ✨

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ha943LSPtTY
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe kwi bhokisi yokudlala yakwa UNICEF: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ha943LSPtTY

SourceText: *Where Did It Go*
text: *Iye phi*

SourceText: Time for a little mystery! 🎁
text: Ixesha lemfihlelo encinci! 🎁

SourceText: 🧸 Hide a small toy under a soft cloth or behind your back and ask, “Where did it go?”
text: 🧸 Fihla ithoyi encinci phantsi kwelaphu elithambileyo okanye emva komqolo wakho kwaye ubuze, "Iye phi?"

SourceText: 👀 Watch your child pull the cloth away or crawl over to investigate.
text: 👀 Mbukele umntwana wakho etsala ilaphu okanye ekhasa ukuze aphande.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns hiding and finding different objects together!
text: 🔄 Tshintshana ngokufihla nokufumana izinto ezahlukeneyo kunye!

SourceText: This game helps your toddler develop memory, curiosity, and helps them understand that things still exist even when they’re out of sight! 💡
text: Lo mdlalo unceda umntwana wakho aphuhlise inkumbulo, umdla, kwaye ibancede baqonde ukuba izinto zisekhona naxa zingekho emehlweni! 💡

SourceText: *Lap Rhyme Bounce*
text: *Ethangeni Ingoma Ukuxhuma*

SourceText: 🧸 Sit your baby gently on your lap and bounce them up and down while chanting a simple rhyme you remember from childhood.
text: 🧸 Hlalisa usana lwakho ngobunono ethangeni lakho kwaye umxhumise phezulu naphantsi ngelixa ucula isicengcelezo esilula osikhumbulayo kwasebuntwaneni.

SourceText: 😃You can speed up or slow down the bounce for extra fun. Add facial expressions or tickles for extra giggles!
text: 😃 Ungakhawulezisa okanye ucothise isantya solonwabo olongezelelweyo. faka imbonakalo yobuso okanye umnyumbaze ukuze agigitheke!

SourceText: This rhythmic lap game builds bonding, listening, and body awareness - just like caregivers have done with little ones for generations 💙
text: Lo mdlalo wesingqi wakha ubudlelwane, ukumamela, kunye nokuqonda umzimba - kanye njengokuba abakhathaleli besenza nabantwana abancinci kwizizukulwane ngezizukulwane 💙

SourceText: *Shadow Play*
text: *Umdlalo Wesithunzi*

SourceText: Step into a world of imagination and light with this exciting activity! 🌙
text: Ngena kwilizwe lokucinga kunye nokukhanya ngalo msebenzi unika umdla! 🌙

SourceText: 💡 In a darkened room, grab a light and shine it at your hand, casting fun shadows onto the wall.
text: 💡Kwigumbi elimnyama, bamba isibane kwaye usikhanyise esandleni sakho, uphose izithunzi ezonwabileyo eludongeni.

SourceText: 👋 Wave at your child and create silly shapes with your fingers - maybe a bunny, a bird, or whatever your imagination dreams up!
text: 👋 Wangawangisa umntwana wakho kwaye wenze iimilo ezisileyo ngeminwe yakho - mhlawumbi unogwaja, intaka, okanye nokuba ucinga ntoni na!

SourceText: 👀 Watch as their curiosity grows, and invite them to try waving their shadow hand back.
text: 👀 Bukela njengoko umdla wabo ukhula, kwaye ubameme ukuba bazame ukuwangawangisa izandla zabo.

SourceText: 🔑 Encourage your little one to take a turn with the flashlight, giving them the thrill of seeing how light can create different shapes and movements on the wall.
text: 🔑 Khuthaza umntwana wakho omncinci ukuba ajike ngesibane, ubanike uchulumanco lokubona indlela ukukhanya okunokwenza ngayo iimilo ezahlukeneyo kunye neentshukumo eludongeni.

SourceText: 🏁 Older children might want to join in the fun and make a shadow animal of their own!
text: 🏁 Abantwana abadala banokufuna ukuzibandakanya kulonwabo kwaye benze isilwanyane esisithunzi ngokwabo!

SourceText: This practical experience helps them understand cause and effect, and boosts their creativity and focus as they make shadows ✅
text: La mava asebenzayo abanceda baqonde unobangela nesiphumo, kwaye konyusa ubuchule babo kunye nokugxila njengoko besenza izithunzi ✅

SourceText: Adapted from Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/play-activities-for-12-to-24-months/
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe kwabaka Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/play-activities-for-12-to-24-months/

SourceText: *Mini Obstacle Race*
text: *Ugqatso Lomqobo Oluncinci*

SourceText: Get ready to set up an exciting adventure right in your home! 🚩
text: Lungiselela ukumisela i adventure eyonwabisayo kakhulu kanye ekhayeni lakho! 🚩

SourceText: 🔶 Using pillows, chairs, and blankets, create a fun and safe obstacle race for your toddler to explore.
text: 🔶 Usebenzisa imiqamelelo, izitulo, kunye neengubo, yenza umqobo owonwabisayo nokhuselekileyo ngenxa yomntwana wakho ukuba awuphonononge.

SourceText: 👋 The goal? For your little one to navigate the course by crawling, jumping, and climbing over, under, and through the obstacles.
text: 👋 Inqaku? Ukuba umntwana wakho omncinci ahambe ikhosi ngokukhasa, ukutsiba, kunye nokukhwela ngaphezulu, ngaphantsi, kunye nokudlula imiqobo.

SourceText: 💡 As they tackle each challenge, they’ll be developing important gross motor skills like coordination, balance, and strength.
text: 💡Njengoko bejongene nomngeni ngamnye, baya kube bephuhlisa izakhono ezibalulekileyo zomveliso womzimba ezifana nolungelelwaniso.

SourceText: 💛Not only will this activity get them moving, but it will also boost their confidence as they conquer each part of the race.
text: 💛 Lo msebenzi awuyi kubenza bashukume kuphela, kodwa uya konyusa ukuzithemba kwabo njengoko besoyisa indawo nganye yogqatso.

SourceText: It’s an easy, playful way to promote physical development while having a great time together! Let the obstacle adventure begin! 🎉
text: Yindlela elula, edlalwayo yokukhuthaza uphuhliso lomzimba ngelixa sonwabe kunye! Vumela i adventure engumqobo iqale!🎉

SourceText: Adapted from Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/10-olympian-inspired-activity-ideas-for-toddlers/
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/10-olympian-inspired-activity-ideas-for-toddlers/

SourceText: *Categorising and Organising*
text: *Ukwahlula nokuCwangcisa*

SourceText: Help your child to learn by sorting objects and things! 🔵🔷
text: Nceda umntwana wakho afunde ngokuhlela izinto zokudlala kunye nezinto 🔵🔷

SourceText: By grouping items like a bear as an animal or a mango as a fruit, they’ll start to understand how different things fit together. 🧸
text: Ngokuqokolela izinto ezifana nebhere njengesilwanyane okanye imengo njengesiqhamo, baya kuqalisa ukuqonda ukuba izinto ezahlukeneyo zidibana njani. 🧸

SourceText: At home, find safe objects and let them sort them by colour, size, or type - plastic cups and plates are perfect for this!
text: Ekhaya, fumana izinto ezikhuselekileyo kwaye ubavumele ukuba bazihlele ngokombala, ubungakanani, okanye uhlobo - iikomity zeplastiki kunye nezitya zifanelekile kule nto!

SourceText: Want to make it more interesting? Try sorting pots and pans by size: Can they fit the small pans into the larger ones? ☕
text: Ufuna ukuyenza inomdla ngakumbi? Zama ukuhlela iimbiza namapani ngokobukhulu: Ingaba bayakwazi ukufaka amapani amancinci kwamakhulu? ☕

SourceText: If you are outside, name different kinds of vehicles on the street or things you see in nature like stones, sticks, trees and flowers. 🌷
text: Ukuba ungaphandle, Xela iintlobo ngeentlobo zezithuthi esitratweni okanye izinto ozibona kwindalo ezifana namatye, iintonga, imithi kunye neentyantyambo. 🌷

SourceText: 🔄 You can play the categorising game anywhere! Just look around and ask your child to find things from the category you say!
text: 🔄 Ungadlala umdlalo wokwahlulahlula naphi na! Jonga ngapha nangapha kwaye ucele umntwana wakho ukuba akhangele izinto kudidi oluthethayo!

SourceText: Sorting and grouping builds thinking skills, memory, and early logic -helping your child make sense of the world around them through playful discovery 🌈
text: Ukuhlela nokwahlulahlula kwakha izakhono zokucinga, inkumbulo, kunye nengqiqo kwasekuqaleni -ukunceda umntwana wakho ukuba aqonde ihlabathi elimngqongileyo ngokufumanisa okudlulayo 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Brain Building Through Play by Harvard University: https://developingchild.harvard.edu/resources/brainbuildingthroughplay/
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Brain Building Through Play by Harvard University: https://developingchild.harvard.edu/resources/brainbuildingthroughplay/

SourceText: *Shapes Everywhere!*
text: *Iimilo yonke indawo*

SourceText: 📺 Squares, squares everywhere
text: 📺Izikwere, izikwere ndawo yonke

SourceText: 👀 Draw squares in the sand or dirt. Make some bigger and some smaller.
text: 👀Zoba izikwere esantini okanye emhlabeni. Zenze ezinye zibenkulu kwaye ezinye zibencinci.

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname, “this is a square.”
text: Xelela u-@fields.child_nickname, "esi siskwere"
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Ask your child to try to draw a square. Hold your child’s hand to help if this is hard.
text: Cela umntwana wakho ukuba azame ukuzoba isikwere. Bamba isandla somntwana wakho ukumnceda ukuba oku kunzima.

SourceText: Look for things around the home or outdoors that are the same shape.
text: Jonga izinto jikelele endlini okanye ngaphandle ukuba imilo ziyafana.

SourceText: Now do the same with circles! 🔴
text: Ngoku yenza njalo kwizangqa!🔴

SourceText: Tell your child, “this is a square.”
text: Xelela umntwana wakho, "esi siskwere.'

SourceText: This simple shape game builds early maths skills, observation, and coordination - right from the start! ✅
text: Lo mdlalo ulula wemilo wakha izakhono zokuqala zezibalo, ukujonga, kunye nolungelelwaniso - kwasekuqaleni! ✅

SourceText: *Active Songs*
text: *Ingoma Ezishukumayo*

SourceText: Young children love to move - and songs with actions make it even more fun! Singing gives your child cues for how and when to move 🎵
text: Abantwana abancinci bayakuthanda ukushukuma - neengoma ezinentshukumo zenza kube mnandi ngakumbi! Ukucula kunika umntwana wakho iimpawu zendlela nexesha lokushukuma 🎵

SourceText: Movement songs build listening skills, self-control, and rhythm - while helping your child learn to follow instructions!
text: Iingoma zentshukumo zakha izakhono zokumamela, ukuzilawula, kunye nesingqi - ngelixa unceda umntwana wakho ukuba afunde ukulandela imiyalelo!

SourceText: Sing songs to @fields.child_nickname or a group of children in which they have to:
text: Cula iingoma ku @fields.child_nickname okanye iqela labantwana ekufuneka benjenjalo:
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: ✅ Start and stop ❌
text: ✅Qala kwaye yeka❌

SourceText: ⬇️ Slow down and speed up ⬆️
text: ⬇️ Yehilsa isantya kwaye nyusa isantya ⬆️

SourceText: Some song ideas:- “If you’re happy and you know it”- “Heads, shoulders, knees and toes”- “Freeze dance” (play or sing music and freeze when it stops!)- “Sleeping bunnies” (sleep, then hop!)
text: Ezinye iimbono zengoma:- "Ukuba wonwabile kwaye uyayazi lonto”- “Intloko, amagxa, madolo neenzwane”- “Umdaniso ka freeze” (dlala okanye ucule umculo kwaye ume ngxi xa uyeka!)- “Imivundla eleleyo” (lala, uze utsibe!)

SourceText: Sing songs to your child or a group of children in which they have to:
text: Culela umntwana wakho iingoma okanye iqela labantwana ekufuneka benjenjalo:

SourceText: *Be the Narrator*
text: *Yiba ngu Mbalisi*

SourceText: 👀 Say what your child is doing while they are playing.
text: 👀 Xela ukuba umntwana wakho wenza ntoni ngelixa edlala.

SourceText: 👂 This will help them learn the words to describe their actions.
text: 👂Lento ingabanceda bafunde amagama ukuchaza iintshukumo zabo.

SourceText: 😃 You can do it in a simple way, or in a silly way like a sports commentator, a news presenter, or a game show host.
text: 😃 Ungayenza ngendlela elula, okanye ngendlela esileyo njengomhlalutyi wezemidlalo, umsasazi weendaba, okanye umamkeli womdlalo.

SourceText: 💡 Ask questions like “What will you do next?” or “I see you want to put the ball in the jar. Is there another way to do that?”
text: 💡 Buza imibuzo enjengale "Uza kwenza ntoni ngokulandelayo?" okanye "Ndiyabona ukuba ufuna ukubeka ibhola kwingqayi. Ingaba ikhona enye indlela yokwenza oko?"

SourceText: *Be an Artist!*
text: *Yiba Ligcisa*

SourceText: 📝 Give @fields.child_nickname some paper and a pen or pencil, or some different pens or pencils.
text: 📝Nika u-@fields.child_nickname naye amaphepha kunye nepen okanye ipensile, okanye ipeni ezahlukeneyo okanye ipensile.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 😃 Let your child draw whatever they want to!
text: 😃 Vumela umntwana wakho azobe nantoni na ayifunayo!

SourceText: 👀 Ask questions about what they are drawing, the size of the thing they are drawing, and the colours they are using.
text: 👀Buza imibuzo malunga nalonto bayizobayo, ubungakanani balonto bayizobayo, kwaye nemibala abayisebenzisayo.

SourceText: 🏆 If possible, put your child’s picture up on the wall when they are finished. Give praise to your child!
text: 🏆 Ukuba kunokwenzeka, beka umfanekiso womntwana wakho eludongeni xa egqibile. Bulela umntwana wakho!

SourceText: 📝 Give your child some paper and a pen or pencil, or some different pens or pencils.
text: 📝Nika amanye amaphepha kunye nepen okanye ipensile, okanye ipeni ezahlukeneyo okanye ipensile.

SourceText: This open drawing time builds imagination, fine motor skills, and confidence - especially when you celebrate their creations! 🎉
text: Eli xesha livulekileyo lomzobo lakha ukucinga, umveliso womzimba ofanelekileyo, kunye nokuzithemba - ngakumbi xa u bhiyozela ubugcisa babo! 🎉

SourceText: *Echo Songs*
text: *Iingoma Ezilinganisayo*

SourceText: 😃 Try a simple call-and-response chant with your child. You say a line, and they copy it back.
text: 😃 Zama ingoma elula yokubiza nokuphendula kunye nomntwana wakho. Utsho umgca, kwaye bawulinganise.

SourceText: 👂 For example:
text: 👂 Umzekelo:

SourceText: You: “Hello there!”
text: Wena: "Molo apho!"

SourceText: Child: “Hello there!”
text: Umntwana: "Molo apho!"

SourceText: You: “How are you?”
text: Wena: "Unjani?"

SourceText: Child: “How are you?”
text: Umntwana: "Unjani?"

SourceText: 💚 Use your own words and language.
text: 💚 Sebenzisa awakho amagama nolwimi.

SourceText: These traditional-style echo songs build turn-taking, memory, and early conversation skills - all through playful singing 🎵
text: Ezi ngoma zesandi somkhwazo zesiko zakha ukutshintshana, inkumbulo, kunye nezakhono zokuncokola kwangethuba 🎵

SourceText: *Circle Clap and Dance*
text: *Yenza isangqa qhwaba kwaye udanise*

SourceText: 👋 Gather a few children (or just you and your little one) and form a small circle.
text: 👋 Qokelela abantwana abambalwa (okanye wena kunye nomntwana wakho) kwaye wakhe isekile encinci.

SourceText: 🎵 Clap your hands in rhythm and sing a well-known local song like: “Shosholoza… ku lezontaba…”
text: 🎵 Qhwaba izandla ngokwesingqi kwaye ucule ingoma eyaziwayo yasekuhlaleni: "Shosholoza... ku lezontaba..."

SourceText: ⭐ As the song plays, take turns dancing into the centre of the circle or copying each other’s moves. Children can jump, spin, or stomp to the beat!
text: ⭐ Njengokuba ingoma idlala, tshintsha tshintshana ukudanisa esiphakathini sesekile okanye nilanganise intshukumo yomnye nomnye. Abantwana banga tsiba, bajikeleze, okanye bangqishe ngokwesingqi!

SourceText: This joyful game builds social confidence, movement skills, and musical rhythm - all while connecting to culture 💛
text: Umdlalo ovuyisayo wakha ukuzithemba ngokwezentlalo, izakhono zeentshukumo, kunye nesingqi somculo - zonke ngelixa sinxulumana ngokwenkcubeko 💛

SourceText: *One-on-One Time*
text: *Ixesha lomnye nomnye*

SourceText: 💚 Spending time just with your child and taking an interest in them can improve your relationship.
text: 💚 Ukuchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho kwaye ubonakalise umdla kungaphucula ubudlelwane bakho.

SourceText: 👀 When your child is playing alone or occupying themselves quietly, join them and show interest in what they are doing.
text: 👀 Xana umntwana wakho ezidlalela yedwa okanye ezihlelele ngokunokwakhe ezolile, mjoyine kwaye ubonakalise umdla kulonto ayenzayo.

SourceText: 👂Ask questions about their activity, and listen to them.
text: 👂 Buza imibuzo ngomsebenzi wabo, uze ubamamele.

SourceText: Let your child lead the activity, follow them to build their confidence and autonomy 😃.
text: Vumela umntwana wakho akhokele umdlalo, mlandele ukwakha ukuzithemba kwakhe kwaye ukuzimela😃.

SourceText: 👀 Say what you see - describing everything and supporting your child’s actions.
text: 👀 Xela into oyibonayo - uchaze yonke into kwaye uxhase izenzo zomntwana wakho.

SourceText: Be positive, praise your child, and enjoy spending this time with them 😃💚
text: Yiba nethemba, ncoma umntwana, kwaye wonwabele ukuchitha elixesha kunye naye 😃💚

SourceText: 📖 Book sharing will help your child learn and is a fun, playful activity to spend quality time together.
text: 📖 Ukwabelane ngencwadi kunganceda umntwana wakho afunde kwaye kuyonwabisa, kungumdlalo ovuyisayo ukuchitha ixesha elibalulekileyo kunye.

SourceText: ⏰ Choose a time when you won’t be disturbed, and try to stop any distractions - e.g. turn off the TV and put away phones.
text: ⏰ Khetha ixesha apho ungayi kuphazanyiswa, kwaye uzame ukumisa naziphi na iziphazamisi - umzekelo cima umabonakude kwaye ubeke iifowuni.

SourceText: 📖 If your child wants to choose a book, that’s fine, otherwise choose for them.
text: 📖 Ukuba umntwana wakho ufuna ukukhetha incwadi, kulungile, kungenjalo mkhethele.

SourceText: 💚 Sit close together and follow your child’s attention and lead.
text: 💚 Hlalani kufutshane kwaye landela ingqwalasela nesikhokelo somntwana wakho.

SourceText: Point at things, name and repeat words. Help them to learn more about what interests them in the book 👀
text: Khomba izinto, biza kwaye uphinde amagama. Bancede bafunde ngakumbi ngezinto abanomdla kuzo kulencwadi👀

SourceText: Link things in the books to your child's life, and use words about emotions and talk about them! 😃
text: Unxibelelanisa izinto ezisencwadini nobomi bomntwana wakho, kwaye usebenzise amagama angeemvakalelo kwaye uthethe ngazo! 😃

SourceText: 🔄 If possible, start a regular routine to read together when your child isn’t too tired or hungry.
text: 🔄 Ukuba kunokwenzeka, qalisani ucwangciso lokufunda kunye xa umntwana wakho engadinwanga kakhulu okanye elambile.

SourceText: Reading together is one of the best ways to help your child learn and prepare for success in school! 🎓
text: Ukufunda kunye yenye yezona ndlela zibalaseleyo zokunceda umntwana wakho afunde kwaye alungiselele impumelelo esikolweni! 🎓

SourceText: 💚 Sit close together and follow your child's attention and lead.
text: 💚 Hlalani kufutshane kwaye landela ingqwalasela nesikhokelo somntwana wakho.

SourceText: If there are words or numbers in the book, ask and help your child recognise letters numbers, and simple words 💡.
text: Ukuba kukho amagama okanye amanani encwadini, buza kwaye uncede umntwana wakho abone amanani oonobumba, kunye namagama alula 💡

SourceText: Link things in the books to your child's life, and use words about emotions and talk about them! 😃.
text: Unxibelelanisa izinto ezisencwadini nobomi bomntwana wakho, kwaye usebenzise amagama angeemvakalelo kwaye uthethe ngazo! 😃.

SourceText: *Animal Acting*
text: *Linganisa Izilwanyana*

SourceText: Get ready to roar like a lion or hop like a kangaroo! 🧸
text: Lungiselela uku gquma njenge ngonyama okanye ukutsiba njenge kangaroo!🧸

SourceText: 📝 To start, write the names of animals on small pieces of paper and put them in a box or container.
text: 📝 Ukuqalisa, bhala amagama ezilwanyana kwiphetshana kwaye ulifake kwibhokisi okanye kwisikhongozeli.

SourceText: 👋 Take turns picking a piece of paper and acting out the animal - can you mimic its sounds and movements? Roar, jump, crawl, or fly just like the animal you picked!
text: 👋 Tshintsha tshintshani ukuchola iphetshana kwaye nilinganise eso silwanyana - ungakwazi ukulinganisa isandi kunye nentshukumo? Gquma, tsiba, khasa, okanye bhabha njengesilwanyana osicholileyo!

SourceText: 🎉 For older kids, turn it into a fun guessing game - see if others can guess which animal you’re pretending to be!
text: 🎉 Kubantwana abadala, tshintshela kumdlalo wokuqikelela owonwabisayo - ubone ukuba abanye bazakukwazi uku qikelela ukuba sesiphi esisilwanyana uzenza sona!

SourceText: This active game helps kids develop physical skills while also supporting speech and language development in a fun way 💚
text: Lomdlalo udlamkisayo unceda abantwana ukukhula kwizakhono zomzimba ngelixa ubaxhasa kwintetho kunye nokhula kolwimi ngendlela eyonwabisayo 💚

SourceText: *Freeze Dance*
text: *Umdaniso ka Freeze*

SourceText: Get ready to dance and freeze with this exciting activity that toddlers love! 🎵
text: Lungiselela umdaniso kwaye u freeze ngomdlalo ohlekisayo othandwa ngabantwana! 🎵

SourceText: 📻 Play some music and let your child dance or move however they like.
text: 📻Dlala umculo kwaye uvumele umntwana wakho adanise okanye ashukume ngohlobo athanda ngalo.

SourceText: ⏸ When the music stops, tell them to freeze – to not move at all! – in one place.
text: ⏸ Xana umculo uyeka, baxelele ukuba ba freeze - bangashukumi noshukuma! - bekwindawo enye.

SourceText: This fun game is great for building listening skills and self-control as they practise stopping and starting ✨
text: Lomdlalo wonwabisayo ulungile kakhulu ukwakha izakhono zokumamela kunye nokukwazi ukuzibamba njengokuba besenza ukumisa kunye nokuqalisa✨

SourceText: It’s also a wonderful way to prepare for school, where they’ll need to follow directions 🔑
text: Ikwayindlela entle ukubalungiselela isikolo, apho kuzakudingeka belandele izalathiso🔑

SourceText: So, turn up the music and enjoy the dancing – and the freezing! 💚
text: Ngoko, vulela umculo phezulu kwaye wonwabele ukudanisa - kunye noku freeza!💚

SourceText: *Mystery Bag*
text: *Ingxowa Yemfihlo*

SourceText: This game is easy and perfect for engaging your toddler’s senses and learning new words 🎁
text: Lo mdlalo ulula kwaye ulungile kakhulu ukubandakanya imvakalelo zomntwana wakho kunye nokufunda amagama amatsha🎁

SourceText: 🏆 Simply place different objects into a bag and ask your child to reach in, feel an item, and guess what it is before pulling it out.
text: 🏆Ngokulula faka izinto ezohlukeneyo kulengxowa kwaye cela umntwana wakho afake isandla, kwaye azive, kwaye aqikelele ukuba yintoni phambi kokuba ayikhuphe.

SourceText: 👋 When they pull out the item, ask them questions to describe what they see: Is it smooth or scary? Bumpy or bright?
text: 👋Xana bekhupha into, buza umbuzo wokuba bachaze ukuba babona ntoni: ithambile okanye iyoyikeka? Iyagqampa okanye iqaqambile?

SourceText: It’s a fun way to introduce new words and stimulate their sense of touch! 💡
text: Yindlela eyonwabisayo yokwazisa amagama amatsha kwaye ikhuthaza imvakalelo zakhe zokuchukumisa!💡

SourceText: Benefits of this activity include expanding vocabulary, developing tactile senses, and practising grouping skills. It’s a wonderful way to mix fun with learning! 🎉
text: Umvuzo walomdlalo uquka ukwandisa ukubiza amagama, ukuphucula ubuchule bemvakalelo, kunye nokuziqhelanisa neqela lezakhono. Yindlela entle ukuxuba ulonwabo kunye nokufunda! 🎉

SourceText: Adapted from British Council: https://learnenglishkids.britishcouncil.org/parents/top-tips/mystery-bag-game
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabe British Council: https://learnenglishkids.britishcouncil.org/parents/top-tips/mystery-bag-game

SourceText: *Body Outline*
text: *Inkcazo Yomzimba*

SourceText: This fun and interactive game helps your toddler learn about different parts of the body 🧸
text: Lo mdlalo wonwabisayo kwaye okusebenzisana unceda umntwana wakho afunde malunga namalungu ahlukeneyo omzimba 🧸

SourceText: 📝 Start by drawing their body outline on a large piece of paper or with a stick on the ground.
text: 📝 Qalisa ngokuzoba umzimba ngokuwuchaza kwiphepha elikhulu okanye ngestokwe emhlabeni.

SourceText: 👂 As you go, ask them to point to and name different body parts. For example, you can say, “Where’s your nose?” or “Can you point to your feet?”
text: 👂 Njengokuba uqhubeka, mcele akhombe kwaye achaze igama lelungu lomzimba ngokohlukana kwawo. Umzekelo, ungathi, " Iphi impumlo yakho?" okanye Ungakwazi ukolatha ezinyaweni zakho?"

SourceText: 👋As they point, encourage them to name each part.
text: 👋 Njengokuba esolatha, mkhuthaze ukuchaza ilungu ngalunye.

SourceText: 🎨 When you are done, you can colour in the outline or decorate it with anything you have in or around the house to make it more creative and engaging!
text: 🎨 Xana ugqibile, ungafaka umbala kulomzobo okanye uhombise ngento yonke onayo okanye ekhona endlini ukwenza ibukeke kwaye ibabandakanye!

SourceText: This fun and creative activity helps your child improve their body awareness, learn new words, and develop fine motor skills 💡
text: Lo mdlalo wonwabisayo kwaye ubukekayo unceda umntwana wakho ukuphuhlisa ukwazi ngomzimba wakhe, ukufunda amagama amatsha, kwaye ukukhulisa izakhono zokubamba 💡

SourceText: *Paper Ball Game*
text: *Umdlalo Webhola Yephepha*

SourceText: Get ready to practice your child’s aim and physical coordination as you play with paper balls together 🔷
text: Lungiselela ukwenza injongo kunye ulungelelwano lomzimba komntwana wakho njengokuba udlala ngebhola yephepha kunye 🔷

SourceText: 📝 Here’s what you’ll need: paper (to scrunch up into balls), and crayons.
text: 📝 Nazi izinto ozidingayo: iphepha (ukulishwabanisa ngokwebhola), kunye ikhrayoni.

SourceText: 🎨 Start by colouring each piece of paper so that it is a unique colour. Now scrunch up the paper until you have a paper ball.
text: 🎨 Qalisa ngokufaka umbala kwiphetshana ukwenzela ibengumbala owohlukileyo. Ngoku shwabanisa iphepha ude ubene bhola yephepha.

SourceText: 🚩 Next, make a goal. You can use markings that already exist, or a clear table surface.
text: 🚩 Okulandelayo, yenza ipali. Ungasebenzisa iimpawu ezise zibonakala, okanye umphezulu wetafile ecacileyo.

SourceText: 🏅 Now you’re ready to play! Take turns tossing your ball towards the goal. Whoever scores or lands closest to the goal wins the round!
text: 🏅 Ngoku ukulungele ukudlala! tshintsha tshintshana ukuphosa ibhola ukuyisa ezipalini. Nokuba ngubani oye wakora okanye wakufuphi nepali uyawuphumelela lomjikelo!

SourceText: This fun and engaging game is perfect for boosting your child’s physical coordination and decision-making skills while keeping them entertained. Let the friendly competition begin! ⭐
text: Lomdlalo wonwabisayo kwaye ubandakanyayo ulungile kakhulu ukunyusa ingqwalasela ngokomzimba yomntwana wakho kunye nezakhono zokwenza izigqibo ngelixa umgcine onwabile. makhe siqale ukhuphiswano lobuhlobo! ⭐

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/jumping-caps
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/jumping-caps

SourceText: *Letter in the Shop*
text: *Ileta ese Venkileni*

SourceText: Turn your next trip to the store into a learning adventure! 🍞
text: Jika uhambo lwakho olulandelayo lokuya kwivenkile lube sisfundo se adventure! 🍞

SourceText: 🍅 As you shop, pick a letter and talk about the items on your shopping list that start with that letter.
text: 🍅 Njengokuba uthenga, khetha unobumba kwaye uthethe malunga nezinto ezikuluhlu lokuthenga eziqala ngalo nobumba.

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child to find other things in the shop that start with the same letter.
text: 👀 Cela umntwana wakho afumane ezinye izinto evenkileni eziqala kwangonobumba ofanayo.

SourceText: This simple activity helps build your child’s letter recognition and vocabulary while keeping them engaged during the shopping trip ✨
text: Lo mdlalo ulula unceda umntwana wakho ukwakha ukuqaphela unobumba kunye nokuthetha ngelixa ibagcina bebandakanyekile ngelixa lohambo lokuthenga ✨

SourceText: It’s a fun, interactive way to learn about letters and sounds in real-world situations, turning an ordinary task into an exciting educational game! 🌈
text: Iyonwabisa, indlela yokunxulumana ukufunda malunga nonobumba kunye nezandi zemeko kwilizwe lamanyani, ukujika umsebenzi oqhelekileyo ubeyinto engumdlalo ofundisayo! 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Sesame Workshop: https://sesameworkshop.org/resources/what-will-we-do/
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Sesame Workshop: https://sesameworkshop.org/resources/what-will-we-do/

SourceText: *Fun with Food*
text: *Ulonwabo ngo Kutya*

SourceText: Cooking can help your child start learning maths!
text: Ukupheka kunganceda umntwana wakho aqalise ukufunda izibalo!

SourceText: 💚 Invite your child to help you cook for your family, or to help you prepare a colourful fruit salad.
text: 💚 Mema umntwana wakho ancede wena ukuphekela usapho, okanye akuncede ekwenzeni i saladi ebukekayo yeziqhamo.

SourceText: 🍅 As you gather the ingredients, ask them to count: 'How many tomatoes do we have?' This builds maths skills and encourages teamwork.
text: 🍅 Njengokuba uqokelela izithako, mcele ukuba abale: "Zingaphi iitomato esinazo?" Lento yakha isakhono sokubala kwaye ikhuthaza umsebenzi weqembu.

SourceText: 5️⃣ Help your child to understand adding and subtracting quantities. 'We need five tomatoes, if we have three, how many more do we need?' This makes learning fun!
text: 5️⃣ Nceda umntwana wakho ukuba aqonde ukudibanisa nokuthabatha izixa. 'Sidinga iitumato ezintlanu, ukuba sinezintathu, zingaphi ezinye esizidingayo?' Oku kwenza ukufunda kube mnandi!

SourceText: 👀 Let’s make it playful! Ask, 'Which is bigger: the tomato or the onion?' This reinforces comparison skills.
text: 👀 Masiyenze idlale! Buza, 'Yeyiphi enkulu: itumato okanye itswele?' Oku komeleza izakhono zokuthelekisa.

SourceText: 🔄 Consider planning a weekly cooking night.
text: 🔄 Cinga ngokucwangcisa ubusuku bokupheka ngeveki.

SourceText: Cooking strengthens your relationship and builds your child’s confidence. Enjoy your cooking adventure together!
text: Ukupheka kuyalomeleza ulwalamano lwenu kwaye kwakha ukuzithemba komntwana wakho. Yonwabele i adventure yakho yokupheka kunye!

SourceText: Adapted from Thrive By Five: https://www.thrivebyfive.com/
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Thrive By Five: https://www.thrivebyfive.com/

SourceText: *Following Instructions*
text: *Ukulandela Imiyalelo*

SourceText: 👂 Play a game in which your child listens to and tries to remember strings of instructions.
text: 👂 Dlala umdlalo apho umntwana wakho amamela khona aze azame ukukhumbula imitya yemiyalelo.

SourceText: This will be useful in school, at home, and later in life!
text: Oku kuya kuba luncedo esikolweni, ekhaya, kwaye kamva ebomini!

SourceText: Start with just one instruction using an object in your home. For example “touch the red ball” 🔴
text: Qala ngomyalelo nje omnye usebenzisa into ekwikhaya lakho. Umzekelo "chukumisa ibhola ebomvu" 🔴

SourceText: Slowly add more instructions (e.g “then pick up the cup "☕), but tell your child that they can only start once you’ve finished giving the instructions.
text: Ngokucotha yongeza eminye imiyalelo (umzekelo "chola ke ikomityi" ☕), kodwa xelela umntwana wakho ukuba bangaqala kuphela wakuba ugqibile ukunika imiyalelo.

SourceText: See how many your child can follow without forgetting!
text: Jonga ukuba zingaphi umntwana wakho anokuzi landela ngaphandle kokulibala!

SourceText: 🔄 Now swap roles! It’s your child’s turn to give you instructions! They can use the same objects if they want.
text: 🔄 Ngoku tshintshana iindima! Lithuba lomntwana wakho ukuba akunike imiyalelo! Banokusebenzisa izinto ezifanayo ukuba bayafuna.

SourceText: You can also try this game with a group of children! Make sure they take turns 😃
text: Ungaphinda uzame lo mdlalo kunye neqela labantwana! Qinisekisa ukuba bayatshintshana 😃

SourceText: *I Spy Colours!*
text: *Ndihlola Imibala!*

SourceText: 👀 Choose an object around you and say: “I spy with my little eye, something that is…” and say the colour of object, like “yellow” or “red”.
text: 👀 Khetha into ekufutshane nawe kwaye uthi: "Ndihlola ngeliso lam elincinci, into eyi..." kwaye utsho umbala wento njengo "tyheli" okanye "bomvu".

SourceText: ✅ Encourage your child to look around and guess what the object might be. When they guess correctly, give them praise and switch roles!
text: ✅ Khuthaza umntwana wakho ukuba ajonge kokukujikelezile kwaye aqikelele ukuba inokuba yintoni na loo nto.

SourceText: 🔑 If they’re having trouble, offer clues like, “It’s round” or “It’s somewhere in that corner".
text: 🔑 Ukuba banenkathazo, banike imikhondo njenge, "Ingqukuva" okanye "Ikwi ndawo ethile kulaa kona".

SourceText: 🔄 Keep the game going with new objects and different colours.
text: 🔄 Gcina umdlalo uqhubeka ngezinto ezintsha kunye nemibala eyahlukeneyo.

SourceText: This classic game is a fun and interactive way to help your child learn words, observe, and stay concentrated. This will help them at home and in school 🏁
text: Lo mdlalo wakudala yindlela eyonwabisayo nesebenzisanayo yokunceda umntwana wakho afunde amagama, ajonge, kwaye ahlale egxila. Oku kuya kubanceda ekhaya nasesikolweni 🏁

SourceText: *I Spy Letters!*
text: *Ndihlola oonobumba!*

SourceText: 👀 I spy is a fun game to play with your child that will help them learn about letters and words!
text: 👀 Ukuhlola ngumdlalo omnandi onokuwudlala nomntwana wakho oya kumnceda afunde ngoonobumba namagama!

SourceText: Choose an object or a thing around you, and don’t tell your child what it is. It should be something that your child knows the word for. For example “ball” ⚽
text: Khetha into okanye into ekungqongileyo, kwaye ungamxeleli umntwana wakho ukuba yintoni na. Kufuneka ibe yinto umntwana wakho alaziyo igama layo. Umzekelo "ibhola" ⚽

SourceText: 👀 Then say “I spy with my little eye, something beginning with *and then say the first letter of the word* which in this case is “b”
text: 👀 Uze uthi "Ndihlola ngeliso lam elincinane, into eqala ngo *uze nditsho unobumba wokuqala wegama* kulo mzekelo ngu "b"

SourceText: Your child should look around and guess what the object is. When they guess it right, praise them and swap roles! If they can’t get it, give them some clues, like “it’s round” or “it’s black and white”. ✅
text: Umntwana wakho kufuneka ajonge kwaye aqikelele ukuba yintoni na loo nto. Xa beqikelela ukuba ilungile, bancome kwaye nitshintshiselane ngeendima! Ukuba abakwazi ukuyifumana, banike imikhondo, njengokuthi "ingqukuva" okanye "imnyama namhlophe". ✅

SourceText: Play this game with as many objects as possible and as many different letters! Help your child to learn about the different letters and sounds in words. This will help them learn to read at home and school. 🎓
text: Dlala lo mdlalo ngezinto ezininzi kangangoko kunye nonobumba abaninzi abahlukeneyo! Nceda umntwana wakho afunde ngoonobumba abahlukeneyo nezandi zamagama. Oku kuya kubanceda bafunde ukufunda ekhaya nasesikolweni. 🎓

SourceText: *What Letter is This?*
text: *Ngowuphi lonobumba?*

SourceText: Playing games with letters can help your child learn the alphabet and how letters are put together to make words.
text: Ukudlala imidlalo ngoonobumba kunokunceda umntwana wakho afunde ialfabhethi nendlela oonobumba abahlanganiswa ngayo ukwenza amagama.

SourceText: 📝 Write a letter on a piece of card or paper (e.g. “p”)
text: 📝 Bhala unobumba kwisiqwenga sekhadi okanye ephepheni (umzekelo. "p")

SourceText: 👂 Say the letter out loud and ask your child to say it too!
text: 👂 Yitsho lonobumba ngokuvakalayo uze ucele umntwana wakho awutsho naye!

SourceText: Ask your child to say some words that begin with the letter “p”, give them clues like “What starts with “p”? Plant… What else? 🌱
text: Cela umntwana wakho ukuba athethe amagama aqala ngonobumba "p", umnike imikhondo efana nale, "Yintoni eqala ngo "p"? Planti... Yintoni enye? 🌱

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child to look for objects in your house that begin with a letter (eg “p” for plate). Help them find things.
text: 👀 Cela umntwana wakho ukuba akhangele izinto endlwini yakho eziqala ngonobumba (umzekelo "p" kwi pleyiti). Bancede bafumane izinto.

SourceText: 🔄 Try a new letter every day!
text: 🔄 Zama ileta entsha yonke imihla!

SourceText: *Riddles Time*
text: *Ixesha lamaqashiso*

SourceText: Riddles and puzzles are a fun way to build thinking skills! 💡
text: Amaqashiso kunye neephazili yindlela eyonwabisayo yokwakha izakhono zokucinga!💡

SourceText: Do you remember any riddles from your childhood? If you can’t then make one up, they can be very simple! 😃
text: Uyawakhumbula amaqashiso awasebuntwaneni bakho? Ukuba awukwazi ngoko wenze enye, zinokuba lula kakhulu!😃

SourceText: Like “What can you see at night but not in the day” Answer: “The moon” 🌙
text: Ngathi "Ungabona ntoni ebusuku kodwa hayi emini" Mpendulo: "Inyanga" 🌙

SourceText: If your child is finding them difficult, try an easy one like: “What is round, bouncy and can be thrown or kicked?” Answer: “A ball” ⚽
text: Ukuba umntwana wakho uzifumana zinzima, zama elula efana nale: "Yintoni engqukuva, egqampayo kwaye inokujulwa okanye ikhatywe?" Impendulo: "Ibhola" ⚽

SourceText: Your child can also try making riddles! 💡
text: Umntwana wakho unokuzama ukwenza amaqashiso! 💡

SourceText: You can have fun with riddles anywhere at any time - like traveling on a bus, walking to school or in a car 🚗
text: Ungonwaba ngamaqashiso naphi na nangaliphi na ixesha - njengokuhamba ngebhasi, ukuhamba ngeenyawo ukuya esikolweni okanye ngemoto 🚗

SourceText: *Make up a Story*
text: *Yenza Ibali*

SourceText: Creating stories together is a great way to have fun with imagination - and to build your child’s creativity! 📖
text: Ukwenza amabali kunye yindlela entle kakhulu yokonwaba ngokuboniswa - kunye nokwakha ubuchule bomntwana wakho! 📖

SourceText: 5️⃣ With your child, come up with 5 words to use. They can be any words you want! For example: banana, spaceship, fish, water, painting, cooking, wedding. If you need to remember them, write them clearly on a paper with your child.
text: 5️⃣ Kunye nomntwana wakho, yiza namagama ama- 5 oza kuwasebenzisa. Anokuba nawaphi na amagama owafunayo! Umzekelo: ibhanana, isiphekepheke, intlanzi, amanzi, ukupeyinta, ukupheka, umtshato. Ukuba ufuna ukuzikhumbula, zibhale ngokucacileyo ephepheni kunye nomntwana wakho.

SourceText: 🎂 Start your story with, “Once upon a time, there was a…” and use one of the words from the list in the first part. For example, “Once upon a time, there was a family who worked on a *banana* farm.”
text: 🎂Qalisa ibali lakho ngokuthi, "Ngaminazana ithile, kwakukho i..." kwaye uqinisekise ukuba usebenzisa elinye lalamagama akuluhlu kwisivakalisi sakho. Umzekelo, " Ngaminazana ithile, kwakukho usapho olwalusebenza kwi fama yama bhanana."

SourceText: 📝 Let your child make up the next part using another word from the list.
text: 📝 Vumela umntwana wakho enze indawo elandelayo esebenzisa elinye igama elikuluhlu.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns until you have used all the words and created a story.
text: 🔄 Tshintshanani de niwasebenzise onke amagama nize niyile ibali.

SourceText: 🔔 Be creative and do not tell your child what to say. It does not need to be a real story to be fun!
text: 🔔 Yiba nobuchule kwaye ungamxeleli umntwana wakho ukuba makathini. Akuyomfuneko ukuba ibe libali lokwenyani ukuze ube mnandi!

SourceText: 🎁 Ask your child what their favourite part of the story was, and tell them yours!
text: 🎁 Buza umntwana wakho ukuba yeyiphi eyona ndawo ebeyithanda kweli bali, uze ubaxelele eyakho!

SourceText: *Playing with Clothes*
text: *Ukudlala ngeMpahla*

SourceText: 💡 Clothes can be the perfect ‘toys’ to help your child build fine motor skills, recognise colours, and think! Here are 3 ideas you can try:
text: 💡Iimpahla zinokuba 'zizinto zokudlala' ezigqibeleleyo zokunceda umntwana wakho akhe izakhono zoku sebenzisa izandla, aqaphele imibala, kwaye acinge! Nazi iimbono ezi- 3 onokuzama:

SourceText: 👋 Practice
text: 👋 Nononga

SourceText: Help your child exercise their fingers by showing them how buttons and zips work on clothes, and letting them practise using them!
text: Nceda umntwana wakho asebenzise iminwe yakhe ngokumbonisa indlela amaqhosha neziphi asebenza ngayo empahleni, kwaye umvumele aziqhelanise nokuzisebenzisa!

SourceText: 🔵 Colours
text: 🔵 Imibala

SourceText: Talk about the colours of clothes! Ask your child to name the colours of their clothes and talk about all the things that are that colour: “What are all the things we can think of that are blue?”
text: Thetha ngemibala yempahla! Cela umntwana wakho ukuba achaze imibala yempahla yakhe kwaye athethe ngazo zonke izinto ezikuloo mbala: "Zeziphi zonke izinto esinokucinga ngazo eziluhlaza?"

SourceText: 🔶 Sorting
text: 🔶 Ukuhlela

SourceText: When you have done laundry, ask your child to help you sort clothes into piles for each family member.
text: Xana ugqibile ukuhlamba impahla, cela umntwana wakho akuncede ukuhlela impahla ngokwemfumba yamalungu osapho.

SourceText: *Playing with Vegetables*
text: *Ukudlala ngeMifuno*

SourceText: 🌱 Help your child learn by thinking and talking about vegetables! Here are 3 ideas for you:
text: 🌱 Nceda umntwana wakho afunde ngokucinga kunye nokuthetha malunga nemifuno! Nazi iingcebiso ezi 3 zakho:

SourceText: 🍅 Sorting vegetablesMix together 2-3 different ingredients of your choice (like onions, tomatoes and corn example). Say: “Help me sort these vegetables into piles?” Try sorting them by size.
text: 🍅 Ukuhlela imifuno  Xubani kunye eziyi2-3 ozihlukeneyo izithako ngoko khetho lwakho (njengetswele, iitumato kunye nombona umzekelo). Yithi: "Ndincede ndihlele imifuno ibeyimfumba?" Zama ukuzihlela ngokobungakanani bazo.

SourceText: 😃 Remind me!
text: 😃 Ndikhumbuze!

SourceText: Talk about your child’s experiences. Ask questions and wait for answers. Follow your child’s interests.
text: Thetha ngamava omntwana wakho. Buza imibuzo kwaye ulinde iimpendulo. Landela umdla womntwana wakho.

SourceText: “Can you help me remember what is at the market?” “Do they sell carrots at the market?” “Do they sell anything yellow at the market?” “What else do they sell?”
text: "Ungandinceda ndikhumbule ukuba yintoni ekhoyo emarikeni?" "Ngaba bayayithengisa iminqathe emarikeni?" "Ngaba bathengisa nantoni na etyheli emarikeni?" "Yintoni enye abayithengisayo?"

SourceText: 💡 Something similar
text: 💡Into efanayo

SourceText: Say: We are going to think of some things that are similar or different from what I tell you. So listen carefully!”
text: Yithi: "Sizocinga ezinye izinto ezifanayo okanye ezahlukileyo kule ndikuxelela yona. Ke undimamele kakuhle!"

SourceText: Here is a tomato. Can you think of something else that is red like a tomato? 🍅
text: Nantsi itumato. Ungacinga enye into ebomvu njengetumata? 🍅

SourceText: Can you think of something else that is round like a tomato? ⚽
text: Ungayicinga enye into engqukuva njengetumato? ⚽

SourceText: These fun food games build memory, observation, and language - helping your child compare, recall, and explore the world through everyday things 🏆
text: Okukutya kolonwabo kwezemidlalo kwakha inkumbulo, ukulolongeka, kwanolwimi - kunceda umntwana wakho athelekise, akhumbule, kwaye aphonononge ihlabathi ngokusebenzisa izinto zemihla ngemihla

SourceText: *Animals*
text: *Izilwanyana*

SourceText: Here are 3 fun animal-related games you can play!
text: Nantsi imidlalo yolonwabo yezilwanyana emithathu onokuyidlala

SourceText: 🧸 Active animals Take turns with @fields.child_nickname doing animal actions: Hop like a frog, stretch like a cat, run like a dog, slither like a snake, flap like a bird.
text: 🧸Izilwanyana ezisebenzayo zibolekisana nge @fields.child_nickname benza amanyathelo ezilwanyana: ukuxhuma oku kweSele, azitwebe oku kweKati, abaleke oku kweNja, arhubuluze nje ngeNyoka, abhenguze ngengeNtaka.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🧸 Active animals Take turns with your child doing animal actions: Hop like a frog, stretch like a cat, run like a dog, slither like a snake, flap like a bird.
text: 🧸 Izilwanyana ezisebenzayo: Tshintshana no xa nisenza izenzo zezilwanyana: tsiba njengesele, zolule okwekati, baleka okwenja, tyibiliza njengenyoka, qhwaba okwentaka.

SourceText: 💡 Groups of animals
text: Iqela lezilwanyana

SourceText: What are all the animals we can think of that have feathers?
text: Zeziphi zonke izilwanyana esinokucinga ngazo ezinentsiba?

SourceText: What are all the animals we can think of that eat plants? 🌱
text: Zeziphi zonke izilwanyana esinokucinga ngazo ezitya izityalo? 🌱

SourceText: What are all the animals we can think of that lay eggs?
text: Zeziphi zonke izilwanyana esinokucinga ngazo ezibeka amaqanda?

SourceText: 😃 Counting rabbits
text: 😃 Ukubala imivundla

SourceText: 🔟 Find 10 rocks and tell your child that they are rabbits!
text: 🔟 Fumana amatye alishumi kwaye uxelele umntwana wakho ukuba yimivundla!

SourceText: Put them in a line and ask them to count the rabbits.
text: Yibeke emgceni kwaye ubacele babale lomivundla.

SourceText: Ask your child to give you 3 rabbits. Say “If you give me 3, how many rabbits do you have?”
text: Cela umntwana wakho akunike imivundla 3. uthi ukuba undinike 3, mingaphi osele nayo?

SourceText: These playful animal games build movement, counting, and thinking skills - while sparking your child’s curiosity about the natural world 🌈
text: Ezizilwanyana zemidlalo zakha intshukumo, ukubala, kwanobuchule bokucinga - ngelixa uxhokonxa umdla womntwana wakho malunga nelizwe ngokwendalo🌈

SourceText: *Active Counting*
text: *Ukubala Okusebenzayo*

SourceText: Here are 2 fun games that help your child learn how to count, listen, and remember!
text: Nantsi imidlalo yolonwabo emi 2 enokunceda umntwana wakho afunde ukuba kubalwa njani, ukumamela, kwano kukhumbula!

SourceText: 👋 Clap, hop, jump:
text: 👋 Ukuqhwaba, Ukutsiba, ukuxhuma

SourceText: Play the following game with @fields.child_nickname. Make it active!
text: Dlala lemidlalo ilandelayo ye @fields.child_nickname. Yenze isebenze!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Clap hands 1 time. 2️⃣ Clap hands 2 times.
text: 1️⃣Qhwaba izandla ngexesha eli 1. 2️⃣Qhwaba izandla amaxesha ama 2.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Jump 1 time. 2️⃣ Jump 2 times.
text: 1️⃣Tsiba ngexesha eli 1. 2️⃣Tsiba amaxesha ama 2.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Hop 1 time. 3️⃣ Hop 3 times.
text: 1️⃣ Tsiba kube 1. 3️⃣ Tsiba ka 3.

SourceText: 💡 Can you hop, then jump, then clap?
text: 💡 Ungatsiba, uze uxhume, uqhwabe iizandla?

SourceText: 🏆 Can you clap twice, jump once, and hop three times?
text: 🏆Ungakwazu ukuqhwaba kabini, utsibe kanye kwaye uxhume amaxesha amathathu?

SourceText: Play the following game with your child. Make it active!
text: Dlala lomdlalo ulandelayo kumnye nomntwana wakho. Wenze ubenomdla!

SourceText: 💡 Remembering Instructions
text: 💡 Ukukhumbula Imiyalelo

SourceText: Take turns to give 2-3 instructions that the other person has to follow. Make sure physical movement is included!
text: Tshintshanani ukudlala lomdlalo apho unika imiyalelo emi 2-3 ukuba omnye umntu akwazi ukukhumbula ukuyilandela. Qinisekisa iintshukumo zomzimba zifakiwe!

SourceText: For example:
text: Umzekelo:

SourceText: - Hop twice, then turn around.
text: - Tsiba kabini, jikeleza.

SourceText: - Jump to the kitchen, pick up a spoon, then run back. ✅
text: - Xhuma ukuya ekhitshini, khetha icephe, ngoko ubaleke ubuye. ✅

SourceText: These active games builds memory, coordination, and listening skills - helping your child follow instructions while moving their body 👋
text: Le midlalo isebenzayo yakha inkumbulo, uququzelelo, kwanesakhono sokumamela - ukunceda umntwana wakho alandele imiyalelo ngelixa esebenzisa umzimba 👋

SourceText: *Thinking Games*
text: *Imidlalo Ecingisisayo*

SourceText: Let’s play some games to help your child think and follow instructions!
text: Masidlale neminye imidlalo enokunceda umntwana wakho acinge kwaye alandele imiyalelo!

SourceText: ❗ Mama/Daddy says!
text: Umama/Utata uthi!

SourceText: Give your child brief instructions to follow, by saying: “Mama/daddy says… touch your head”.
text: Nika umntwana wakho imiyalelo emfutshane ayilandele, ngokuthi: "Umama/Utata uthi... bamba intloko yakho".

SourceText: “Mama/daddy says… jump twice”.
text: ''Mama/Tata uthi... xhuma ka bini''.

SourceText: Once your child understands the game well, you can make it more complicated!
text: Xana umntwana wakho ewuqonda kakuhle umdlalo, ungawenza ubenobunzimanyana!

SourceText: “Mama/daddy says… jump, then clap and sit”.
text: "Umama/Utata uthi... xhuma, uphinde uqhwabe izandla kwaye uhlale".

SourceText: 🔵 🔴 Blue-Red
text: 🔵 🔴 Hlaza-Bomvu

SourceText: Say a colour, and your child needs to quickly find and touch something of that colour.
text: Yitsho umbala, kwaye umntwana wakho uzakudinga afumane ngokukhawuleza kwaye abambe into enalombala.

SourceText: To make the game harder, you can choose two colours and tell your child they should touch the opposite colour!
text: Ukwenza lomdlalo ubenobunzima, ungakhetha imibala ibemibini kwaye uxelele umntwana wakho kufuneka abam be ongafanayo umbala!

SourceText: “If I say blue, you should touch something red. If I say red, you need to touch something blue.”
text: Ukuba ndithi luhlaza, umele kukubamba into ebomvu. Ukuba ndithi bomvu, udinga ukuba ubambe into eluhlaza.''.

SourceText: Try these games to help your child build listening skills, follow instructions, and have fun - all at the same time!
text: Zama lemidlalo ukunceda umntwana wakho akwazi ukwakha isakhono sokumamela, alandele imiyalelo, onwabele - konke kwangaxesha - nye!

SourceText: 👂 Go and stop
text: 👂Hamba kwaye ume

SourceText: Say: When I say “stop”, we freeze. When I say “go”, we can walk again.
text: Ithi: Xana ndisithi " yima", siyama siqine. Xana ndisithi"hamba", singahamba kwakhona.

SourceText: Once @fields.child_nickname is familiar with the game, @fields.child_nickname will lead.
text: Kanye @fields.child_nickname eseqhelene kunye nomdlalo, @fields.child_nickname uzaku khokela.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Once your child is familiar with the game, your child will lead.
text: Kanye umntwana wakho eqhelene kunye nalo mdlalo, umntwana wakho angakhokela.

SourceText: *Games with Pictures!*
text: *Imidlalo engemifanekiso*

SourceText: Any picture or image can turn into a game:
text: Nawuphi na umfanekiso okanye ifoto ungajika ibe ngumdlalo:

SourceText: 👂 Making up a story
text: 👂 Ukwenza ibali

SourceText: Find a picture with people or animals in an old newspaper, book, or magazine, or on packaging.
text: Fumana umfanekiso onabantu okanye izilwanyane kwiphephandaba elidala, incwadi, imagazini, okanye kwipakethe.

SourceText: Say: “Let’s make up a story about this picture. I can start. This little girl is feeling very excited today. Why do you think she is feeling excited?”
text: Yithi: "Masenze ibali ngalo mfanekiso. Ndingaqala. Le ntombazana incinci iziva inemincili namhlanje. Ucinga ukuba kutheni eziva enemincili?"

SourceText: 😃 “She is holding her bag and has a big smile. Where do you think she is going?”
text: 😃 "Uphethe ibhegi yakhe kwaye unoncumo olukhulu. Ucinga ukuthi uyaphi?"

SourceText: 👀 Can you guess it?
text: 👀 Ungayiqikelela?

SourceText: Say: “I am going to describe something on the page and you need to guess what it is and point to it”. For example, “I see something that is green and moves slowly.
text: Yithi: "Ndiza kuchaza into ekwiphepha kwaye kufuneka uqikelele ukuba yintoni kwaye ukhombe kuyo". Umzekelo, "Ndibona into eluhlaza kwaye ihamba kancinci.

SourceText: Can you guess what it is?” 💚
text: Ungakwazu ukuqashela ukuba yintoni?💚

SourceText: These playful games build imagination, language, and thinking skills - while helping your child listen and express their own ideas in a fun way 💡
text: Le midlalo idlalwayo yakha ukucinga, ulwimi, isakhono sokucinga - ngelixa unceda umntwana wakho ukuba aphulaphule kwaye aveze ezakhe izimvo ngendlela eyonwabisayo 💡

SourceText: *Tell Me a Story!*
text: *Ndixelele Ibali*

SourceText: 👂 Sit together in a cosy spot and begin a story the traditional way in your home language, like “Once upon a time...”
text: 👂 Hlalani kunye kwindawo epholileyo kwaye niqale ibali ngendlela yesiko kulwimi lwakho lwasekhaya, njengokuthi "Kudalala..."

SourceText: ✨ Use your voice, hands, and expressions to bring the story to life. It could be about animals, a clever child, or a talking tree! Let your child add sounds or repeat words. You can even ask them what happens next!
text: ✨ Sebenzisa ilizwi lakho, izandla, kunye neentetho ukwenza ibali libe yinyaniso. Isenokuba malunga nezilwanyane, umntwana okrelekrele, okanye umthi othethayo! Vumela umntwana wakho ongeze izandi okanye aphinde amagama. Unokubabuza ukuba yintoni enokwenzeka elandelayo!

SourceText: 💡 Traditional storytelling builds language, imagination, and cultural identity - and creates beautiful quiet time together.
text: 💡 Isiko lokubalisa ibali kwakha ulwimi, ukucinga, kunye nokuzazi ngokwenkcubeko - kwaye yenza ixesha elizolileyo elihle kunye.

SourceText: *Proverb Play*
text: *Dlala Iqhalo*

SourceText: Let’s bring wisdom to life through play! ✨
text: Masenze ubulumko ebomini ngokudlala! ✨

SourceText: 🌱 Think of a traditional proverb and act it out together. Pretend to be the animal or act out the scenario of the proverb - use movement, voices, and imagination!
text: 🌱 Cinga ngeqhalo lemveli nililinganise kunye. Zenze isilwanyane okanye ulinganise imeko yeqhalo - sebenzisa intshukumo, amazwi kunye nokucinga!

SourceText: 📖 Here are some ideas to get you started:
text: 📖 Nazi ezinye iimbono ukuze uqalise:

SourceText: - “Even an ant can hurt an elephant” - Pretend to be a big stomping elephant, then tiny ants that tickle its feet!
text: - "Kwanembovane inokumenzakalisa indlovu" - Zenze indlovu enkulu enyathelayo, emva koko iimbovane ezincinci ezinyumbaza inyawo zayo!"

SourceText: - “The lion doesn’t turn around when a small dog barks” - Be the calm, wise lion ignoring a noisy pup.
text: - "Ingonyama ayijiki xa kukhonkotha inja encinane" - Yiba yingonyama ezolileyo, elumkileyo, ungayihoyi injana engxolayo.

SourceText: - “Wisdom is like a baobab tree - no one can embrace it alone” - Stand in a circle and stretch your arms to build a tree together.
text: - "Ubulumko bufana nomthi we baobab - Akukho bani unokuwamkela eyedwa" - Yimani kwisangqa kwaye wolule iingalo zakho ukwakha umthi kunye.

SourceText: - “A single bracelet does not jingle” - Clap or tap together and see how much louder it is with more hands!
text: - "Isacholo esinye asikhencezi" - Qhwaba okanye ucofe kunye kwaye ubone ukuba ingxola kangakanani na ngezinye izandla!

SourceText: 👀Ask your child what they think the proverb means.
text: 👀 Buza umntwana wakho ukuba ucinga ukuba lithetha ukuthini eli qhalo.

SourceText: This playful activity helps children explore big ideas like courage, kindness, and teamwork - through their bodies and imagination 💡
text: Lo msebenzi wokudlala unceda abantwana baphonononge imibono emikhulu njengoku khalipha, ububele, kunye nokusebenzisana - ngemizimba yabo kunye nokucinga 💡

SourceText: *I'm a Writer!*
text: * Ndingu Mbhali!*

SourceText: 📝 Have fun being creative with writing!
text: 📝Yonwaba ngokuba nobuchule ngokubhala!

SourceText: You and @fields.child_nickname can have fun writing with a pencil and paper, or with a stick and the sand!
text: Wena kunye no@fields.child_nickname ningakonwabela ukubhala nge pensile kunye nephepha, okanye nentonga kunye nesanti!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: If your child doesn’t know how to write letters, encourage them to draw shapes, and try to copy the shapes of letters. 🔵▶️
text: Ukuba umntwana wakho akakwazi ukubhala oonobumba, mkhuthaze ukuba azobe iimilo, kwaye azame ukukopa iimilo zoonobumba. 🔵▶️

SourceText: When they are more confident, encourage them to write letters and even words. 😃
text: Xa bezithembile, bakhuthaze ukuba babhale oonobumba kwanamagama. 😃
