SourceText: Start showing them how to write their name and other important words for them, like mom, ball or milk.
text: Qala ukubabonisa indlela yokubhala amagama abo kunye namanye amagama abalulekileyo kubo, njengomama, ibhola okanye ubisi.

SourceText: Show them the simple things that you write - like shopping lists! Show them the words and each of the letters. Let them try to copy the words! 📖
text: Babonise izinto ezilula ozibhalileyo - njengo luhlu lokuthenga! Babonise amagama kunye neeleta nganye. Bavumele bakope amagama!📖

SourceText: You and your child can have fun writing with a pencil and paper, or with a stick and the sand!
text: Wena kunye no ningakonwabela ukubhala nge pensile kunye nephepha, okanye nentonga kunye nesanti!

SourceText: 🎉This playful writing time builds confidence, creativity, and early literacy - helping your child see that writing is useful and fun.
text: 🎉 Eli xesha lokubhala lidlalayo lakha ukuzithemba, ubuchule, kunye nokufunda kwasekuqaleni - ukunceda umntwana wakho abone ukuba ukubhala kuluncedo kwaye kumnandi.

SourceText: *A Friendly Chat*
text: *Incoko yobuhlobo*

SourceText: Talk to your child about something that they are interested in! 😃
text: Thetha nomntwana wakho ngento anomdla kuyo! 😃

SourceText: 💚 Spending quality time with your child and talking to them every day is a good way to develop a strong relationship.
text: 💚 Ukuchitha ixesha elibalulekileyo kunye nomntwana wakho kunye nokuthetha nabo yonke imihla yindlela elungileyo ukukhulisa ubudlelwane obuqinileyo.

SourceText: ⚽ An easy way to start talking to your child is to ask them about something they are interested in, for example you could talk about topics such as: sports, books, movies, friends, music, celebrities, or school.
text: ⚽ Indlela elula ukuqalisa ukuthetha nomntwana wakho kukubuza malunga nento abanomdla kuyo. Umzekelo, ungathetha malunga nomdlalo, iincwadi, imiboniso bhanyabhanya, abahlobo, umculo, oosaziwayo, okanye isikolo.

SourceText: 👂 You may not find everything your child shares to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.
text: 👂 Ungangafumani yonke into abelana ngayo umntwana wakho enomdla, kodwa kubalulekile ukubonisa umdla kwaye nentumakelelo yokufunda.

SourceText: Talking about their interests builds trust, confidence, and communication skills - and shows your child that what they care about matters to you 💛
text: Ukuthetha malunga nemidla yabo kwakha ithemba, ukuzethemba, nesakhono sokunxulumana - kwaye bonisa umntwana wakho ukuba akukhathaleleyo kubalulekile kuwe 💛

SourceText: *Get Active*
text: *Qalisa ukusebenza*

SourceText: Exercise is a great way to spend time together and it is so good for your health.
text: Ukuzilolonga kuyeyona ndlela yakhe yankulu ukuchitha ixesha nikunye kwaye ilunge kakhulu malunga nempilo yakho

SourceText: 🌱 Find a sport or exercise that both you and your child want to do and try it out together!
text: 🌱 Funa umdlalo okanye ukuzilolonga nobabini nomntwana wakho enizakuwenza kwaye wuzameni kunye!

SourceText: ⏰ Even walking for 10 minutes a day is good for you.
text: ⏰Nokuba kukuhamba kangange mizuzu eyi 10 ngosuku kulungile kuwe.

SourceText: ⚽ Together you can walk, run, play soccer, swim, dance, or do any other sport.
text: ⚽ Kunye ningahamba, nibaleke, nidlale ibhola, niqubhe, nidanise, okanye nenze omnye umdlalo.

SourceText: 🏆 Together, think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns being the coach? Can there be a small, free reward, like getting to decide the next activity?
text: 🏆Kunye, cingani ngeendlela ezinokuyenza yonwabise kakhulu. Ungabaleke ukuyokufika kwindawo ethile? tshintsha nani ukuba ngumqeqeshi? Ingakhe ibencinci, Umvuzo wamahala, ndiyathanda ukufumana ukugqiba ngomdlalo olandelayo?

SourceText: 🌈 Exercise becomes easier and more enjoyable the more you do it.
text: 🌈Ukuziocavoca kuba lula kwaye konwabise rhoqo usenza.

SourceText: 🔄 If you or your child do not like the first exercise you pick, try a new exercise.
text: 🔄 Ukuba wena okanye umntwana wakho anikuthandi ukuzivocavoca kokuqala benikukhethile, zamani okutsha ukuzivocavoca.

SourceText: *Pass the Ball*
text: *Dlulisa ibhola*

SourceText: Games are a great, fun way to spend time with your family!
text: Imidlalo yinto entle, indlela eyonwabisayo ukuchitha ixesha kunye nosapho lwakho!

SourceText: 3️⃣ This game is best with at least 3 people.
text: Lo mdlalo umnandi ngakumbi xa kukho abantu aba-3 ubuncinane.

SourceText: ⚽ Find a ball to play. If you cannot find a ball, choose an item you can safely throw around. For example, a bottle cap or a plastic cup.
text: ⚽Fumana ibhola ukudlala. Ukuba awuyifumani ibhola, khetha nayiphina ekhuselekileyo ukujulisana ngayo. Umzekelo, isiciko sebhotile okanye ikomityi yeplastiki.

SourceText: ➡️ Start in a circle and pass the ball around.
text: ➡️ Qala kwisangqa kwaye dlulisa ibhola jikelele.

SourceText: 👋 Start throwing the ball in new directions (up, down, straight, curved, rolling on the ground) and with different forces (hard, soft, medium). You can bounce the ball, throw it in the air, and catch it a few times before passing it.
text: 👋Qala ukuphosa ibhola kwindlela ezahlukeneyo (phezulu, phantsi, ngqo, ngegope, ukuqengqeleka emhlabeni) kwaye kunye namandla ahlukeneyo ( nzima, thambileyo, phakathi). Ungakwazi ukugqampisa ibhola, uyiphose emoyeni, kwaye uyibambe amaxesha ambalwa phambi kokuba uyidlilise.

SourceText: ✨ When everyone gets good at catching the ball, you can start moving around the room, still passing the ball.
text: ✨Xana wonke umntu eyibamba kakuhle ibhola, ningakwazi uqala ukujikeleza egumbini, nidlulisa ibhola.

SourceText: ⭐ Can you throw the ball under the leg? Behind the back? Over your head? Block a pass? Have fun with it!
text: ⭐ungakwazi wena ukuphosa ibhola ngaphantsi kwemilenze? Ngemva? Ngaphezu kwentloko yakho? Uvalele ukupas? Yonwabele!

SourceText: This lively game helps you connect to your child in a fun way - while building their coordination, teamwork, and focus 🚩
text: Lomdlalo uphilileyo ukunceda kunxulumano nomntwana wakho ngendlela eyonwabisayo - logama usakha ulungelelwaniso lwabo, iqela lokusebenza, kwane ngqwalasela 🚩

SourceText: *Follow the Leader!*
text: * Landela Inkokheli!*

SourceText: ⭐ Choose someone to be the leader (tip: start with an adult like yourself).
text: ⭐ Khetha omnye umntu ukuba abe yinkokheli (ingcebiso: qala ngomntu omdala njengawe).

SourceText: 😃 Other players line up behind the leader. The leader moves around in any way they like!
text: 😃Abanye abadlali bama umgca emva kwenkokheli. Inkokheli ijikeleza ndlela abafuna ngayo!

SourceText: 🏁 They can run, jump, crawl, walk on tiptoe, and any other way they want!
text: 🏁Bngabaleka, baxhume, bakkhase, bahambe ngenzwane, kwaye nangeyiphina indlela abafuna ngayo!

SourceText: 👀 The other players must copy what the leader does, and the leader can change movements at any time.
text: 👀Abanye abadlali kufuneka bakope into eyenziwa yinkokheli, inkokheli ingazitshintsha iintshukumo nangeliphina ixesha.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns being the leader, and remember, you can play with just two people or as many as you want!
text: 🔄 Bolekisani ngobukhokheli, kwaye khumbula, ungadlala nabantu ababini nje okanye nabangakanani na ngokokufuna kwakho!

SourceText: This game builds movement skills, attention and listening, and self-control, while having fun together! 👂
text: Lomdlalo wakha ubuchule bentsukumo, ingqalelo kwano kuphulaphula, kwanokuzeyisa, logama niseva ubumnandi kunye! 👂

SourceText: *Emotion Cards*
text: *Amakhadi emvakalelo*

SourceText: Create cards of the main six emotions with @fields.child_nickname: happy, sad, angry, disgusted, surprised, afraid 😃😔😣
text: 📝 Yenza icwecwe leeemvakalelo ezintandathu kunye no@fields.child_nickname: ukunwaba, khathazeka, umsindo, ukucaphuka, ukumangaliseka, ukoyika 😃😔😣
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🔶 Draw, cut-out pictures from magazines, or take photos of family members showing different emotions.
text: 🔶 Zoba, sika imifanaekiso kumagazine, okanye uthathe iifoto zamalungu osapho ebonisa imvakalelo ezahlukeneyo.

SourceText: 📝 Label each emotion and describe how each family member feels those emotions.
text: 📝 U yi leyibhule imvakalelo nganye kwaye wongeze amagama amalunga nelunga ngalinye losapho ngendlela abaziva ngayo ezomvakalelo.

SourceText: Create cards of the main six emotions with your child: happy, sad, angry, disgusted, surprised, afraid 😃😔😣
text: 📝 Yenza icwecwe leeemvakalelo ezintandathu kunye no: ukunwaba, khathazeka, umsindo, ukucaphuka, ukumangaliseka, ukoyika 😃😔😣

SourceText: 🚩 Put the cards in a spot everyone agrees on, and use it throughout the day to name how everyone is feeling. For example, after school, everyone can point out the emotion they are experiencing.
text: 🚩 Beka icwecwe kwindawo apho wonke umntu avumelene ngayo, kwaye uyisebenzi kulo lonke elosukuukubonisa ukuba usapho luziva njani. Umzekelo, emva kwesikolo, wonke umntu angaphawula ngemvakalelo abayivayo.

SourceText: 💡 Feel free to add new feelings as they come up. If someone doesn’t know what they are feeling, help them identify it by exploring how it feels in their body. Try together to find a new word for that emotion.
text: 💡 Khululeka ukongeza iimvakalelo ezintsha njengokuba zivela. Ukuba ubani akazazi ukuba uziva njani, bancede ukuziqaphela ngokuziphonononga baziva njani emzimbeni. Zamani kunye ukufumana igama elitsha ngalo mvakalelo.

SourceText: This can help everyone in the family become experts in understanding themselves and be aware of what their bodies need! 💛
text: Lento inganceda wonke umntu kusapho abe yingcaphephe ekuqondeni kunye nokuqaphela ukuba yintoni edingwa yimizimba yabo! 💛

SourceText: *What's New?*
text: *Yintoni Entsha?*

SourceText: Learning together is fun! 🎓
text: Kumnandi ukufunda sonke! 🎓

SourceText: ❓ Ask your child to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together.
text: ❓ Cela umntwana wakho acinge ngento entsha, isakhono esonwabisayo eningasifunda kunye.

SourceText: For example: keeping a ball in the air with your foot, juggling, making soup, moonwalking, whistling, saying the alphabet backwards, learning all the countries in Africa.
text: Umzekelo: ukugcina ibhola emoyeni ngonyawo lwakho, uku jugila, ukwenza isuphu, ukuhamba kwenyanga, ukubetha umlozi, ukutsho ii alfabhethi ubuya ngasemva, ukufunda ngamazwe onke ase Afrika.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns trying out the new skill. Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!
text: 🔄 Nitshintshisane ngokuzama isakhono esitsha. Qinisekani ukuba niyancomana kwaye nifunde kwaye nidlale kunye!

SourceText: 💛 Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your child or yourself for your ability in the skill.
text: 💛 Funda isakhono ngendlela enobubele neyonwabisayo, kwaye ungamgwebi umntwana wakho okanye wena ngokwakho ngokukwazi kwisakhono.

SourceText: 😃 Once you have mastered the skill, choose another skill to learn together.
text: 😃 Wakuba uphumelele kwisakhono, khetha esinye isakhono eninokusifunda kunye.

SourceText: *Five Stones*
text: *Amatye Amahlanu*

SourceText: Let’s test your speed and skill with this classic hand game played across South Africa! ⭐
text: Masivavanye isantya kunye nesakhono sakho ngalo mdlalo wezandla wakudala odlalwa kuMzantsi Afrika wonke! ⭐

SourceText: 5️⃣ You’ll need five small stones (or any small objects you have around).
text: 5️⃣ Uya kudinga amatye amancinci amahlanu (okanye naziphi na izinto ezincinci onazo).

SourceText: ▶️ Start by placing all five on the ground. Pick up one and throw it gently into the air. While it’s in the air, quickly grab one stone from the ground and catch the first stone before it lands.
text: ▶️ Qala ngokubeka onke womahlanu phantsi. Chola elinye ulijule kancinci emoyeni. Ngelixa lisemoyeni, khawuleza ubambe ilitya elinye phantsi kwaye ubambe ilitye lokuqala ngaphambi kokuba liwe.

SourceText: 🔄 Repeat this, picking up one stone at a time. Then try two at once, then three... all the way to four!
text: 🔄 Phinda oku, uchola ilitye libe linye ngexesha. Uze uzame amabini ngaxeshanye, emva koko abemathathu... ukuya kutsho kwamane!

SourceText: 🚩 Play alone or with friends, and see who can complete the challenge without dropping a stone!
text: 🚩 Dlala wedwa okanye nabahlobo, kwaye ubone ukuba ngubani onokugqiba umngeni ngaphandle kokuwisa ilitye!

SourceText: This traditional game builds hand-eye coordination, focus, and timing - and it’s lots of fun to master ✅
text: Lomdlalo wemveli wakha ukwazi ukuququzelela, ingqwalasela kwane xesha - kwaye inokonwaba okuninzi okongamileyo ✅

SourceText: *Clap & Sing Game*
text: *Ukuqhwaba noku Cula umdlalo*

SourceText: 🎵 Sit face-to-face with your child and try a fun clapping rhyme together.
text: 🎵 Hlala ujongane ubuso nobuso nomntwana wakho kananjalo zamani ukonwabela isingqi sokuqhwaba kunye.

SourceText: 👋 Clap your hands, then each other’s, and repeat with a rhythm and song from your childhood – or make up a new one.
text: 👋 Qhwabani iizandla zenu, umntu ngamnye', kwaye niphinda phinda isingqi kwaye ibeyingoma yasebutsheni benu - kungenjalo ningaqamba entsha.

SourceText: 💚 Follow the words with a simple clapping pattern. You can swap in your own words or names to make it even more fun!
text: 💚 Landelani amagama nendlela elula yokuqhwaba ngendlela enye. Ningayitshintsha ngawenu amagama okanye amagama anokuyenza ibemnandi nangakumbi!

SourceText: These clapping games have been popular among children from generation to generation, and help build rhythm, timing, memory, and laughter ✨
text: Lemidlalo yokuqhwaba ibikhe yathandwa phakathi kwabantwana ukusuka kwisizukulwane ngesizukulwane, kwaye inceda ekwakheni isingqi, ixesha, inkumbulo, kwano kuhleka ✨

SourceText: *Skipping Rope Song*
text: *Ingoma yokutsiba intambo*

SourceText: 🎈 Find a long rope or make one from tied-up tights or string.
text: 🎈 Fumana intambo ende okanye wenze eqinileyo nebotshiweyo okanye ibengumtya.

SourceText: 2️⃣ Two people turn the rope while one jumps in the middle.
text: 2️⃣ Abantu ababini bazakujija intambo ngelixesha omnye exhumaxhuma esiphakathini.

SourceText: 🎵 Sing a song together as they jump – do you remember one from your childhood or can you use a different song you all know?
text: 🎵 Bacula ingoma logama bexhuma xhuma - uyayikhumbula enye yazo yasebuntwaneni bakho okanye ungasebenzisa enye yengoma eyahlukileyo yazo

SourceText: 🏆 You can add fun moves like hopping, clapping, or even dancing while skipping.
text: 🏆 Ungongeza nenye intshukumo yobumnandi efana nokungcileza, ukuqhwaba okanye nkqu ukusina ngelixesha nitsiba - tsiba.

SourceText: 💛 Then switch places so everyone gets a turn.
text: 💛 Ngexesha ucofa iindawo ukuze wonke umntu ajike.

SourceText: This energetic game builds coordination, confidence, and teamwork - and brings a joyful beat to any outdoor play session 🌈
text: Lomdlalo ukhutheleyo wakha uququzelelo, ukuzethemba, kwaneqela lokusebenza - kwaye uzisa isithonga sovuyo nakowuphi na umhlangano womdlalo wangaphandle 🌈

SourceText: *Three Tin Tower*
text: *Iinqaba ezi 3 zeetoti*

SourceText: 🔶 Stack three empty tins into a tower.
text: 🔶 Khabela iitoti ezi 3 kwinqaba.

SourceText: 🔵 One player throws a soft ball to knock them down while others run away.
text: 🔵 Umdlali omnye ajule ibhola ethambileyo ingqube ezinye ziwe ngelixesha ezinye zibaleka.

SourceText: ⏰ The “tin guard” collects and rebuilds the tower as quickly as possible while trying to tag the runners.
text: ⏰ Umlondolozi weetoti uyakuziqokelela aphinde akhe inqaba ngokukhawuleza okukhulu ngelixesha ezama ukuphawula ababaleki.

SourceText: 🔄 If you get tagged, you switch roles!
text: 🔄 Ukuba uye waphawulwa, uyakuxinzelela iindima!

SourceText: This game is lots of fun and builds teamwork, movement skills, and fast thinking 🎉
text: Lomdlalo inobumnandi obuninzi kwaye wakha iqela lokusebenza, isakhono sokunyakaza, nokucinga okukhawulezileyo 🎉

SourceText: *Story Stones*
text: *Ibali lamatye*

SourceText: 🔴 Sit quietly with a handful of small stones.
text: 🔴 Hlala ngokuzolileyo nenqumba yamatye amancinane.

SourceText: 📖 Let your child imagine what the stones are, move them around and tell a story in their own words. It might be about animals, people, dreams, or anything they imagine.
text: 📖 Makhe umntwana wakho acinge ukuba ayintoni na amatye, awasuse aze abalise ibali ngamagama awo. umhlawumbi kungamalunga nezilwanyana, abantu, amaphupha, okanye nayiphi na into abanokucinga ngayo.

SourceText: 👂You can listen quietly or help shape the story together.
text: 👂 Ungaphulaphula ngokuzolileyo okanye uncede umilise ibali ndawonye.

SourceText: This solo storytelling tradition helps children express feelings, practise language, and explore imagination - all through play and pretend 💛
text: Lamabali emveli anceda abantwana bachaze iimvakalelo zabo, benze ulwimi, baphonononge ingcamango - konke ngokusebenzisa umdlalo nokuzenzisa 💛

SourceText: It’s a beautiful, calming game rooted in traditional storytelling 🌙
text: Mhle, ngumdlalo wamabali ozolileyo nomiliselwe kwimveli 🌙

SourceText: *Hopscotch Fun*
text: *Ukutsiba isikhotshi Esonwabisayo*

SourceText: Let’s jump into a classic game! ☀️
text: Masixhumele kumdlalo ohlonelwayo! ☀️

SourceText: 🔷 Draw a hopscotch grid on the ground using chalk, a stick in the sand, or even tape on the floor indoors. Number the squares from 1 to 9.
text: 🔷 Zoba isikhotshi sokutsiba emhlabeni ngetshokhwe, istokhwe esantini, okanye itheyiphu kumgangatho wangaphakathi endlini. bala izikwere ukusuka ku 1 ukuya ku 9.

SourceText: 🔴 Give your child a small object (like a stone or bottle top) to toss into square 1.
text: 🔴 Nika umntwana wakho into encinci (njengelitye nokuba sisiciko sembodlela) uphose esikwereni soku 1.

SourceText: ⬆️ Then they hop through the squares on one foot—skipping the square with the marker—then turn around and come back.
text: ⬆️ Abe etsiba ezikwereni ngenyawo elinye - atsibe isikwere esinophawu - abesele ejika ebuyela emva.

SourceText: ⬇️ Stop to pick up the marker on the way back, still hopping!
text: ⬇️ Yima uchole usiba endleleni ebuyayo, usaqhubeka nokutsiba tsiba!

SourceText: 🔄 Next round: throw the marker into square 2... and so on.
text: 🔄 Umjikelezo olandelayo: phosa usiba kwisikwere 2... uqhubeke kanjalo.

SourceText: Hopscotch builds balance, counting, turn-taking, and fun movement skills. You can sing as you hop or make your own rules for extra challenge! 🎈
text: Umdlalo wokutsiba tsiba wakha ukulungelelanisa, ukubala, ukutshintshana ngesakhono sokunyakaza esivuyisayo. Ungacula ngelixesha utsiba tsiba qamba imithetho yakho ukwenza umceli - mngeni owongeziweyo! 🎈

SourceText: *Pattern Discovery*
text: *Fumana iPhethini*

SourceText: Did you know that patterns are all around us? 🎨
text: Ubuyazi ukuba i phetheni isiqongile? 🎨

SourceText: 🌷 Explore patterns together - whether it's the rows of palm trees outside or the design on their clothes.
text: 🌷 Hlola iphethini kunye - nokuba yimiqolo yemithi yesundu ngaphandle okanye uyilo ezimpahleni zabo.

SourceText: 🔷 Line up colourful blocks, rocks, or feathers, or draw a pattern using simple shapes. Ask your child questions like: “What comes next?’” or “Can you create your own pattern?”
text: 🔷 Dwelisa izitena ezinemibala, okanye amasiba, okanye uzobe iphetheni ukusebenzisa imilo ezilula. Buza umntana wakho imibuzo enje: "Yintoni elandelayo?" okanye "ungakwazi ukwakha eyakho iphethini?"

SourceText: 🎉Remember to encourage and celebrate their curiosity as they explore the world of patterns!
text: 🎉 Khumbula ukubakhuthaza kwaye uvuyisane nomdla njengokuba behlola ilizwe le phetheni!

SourceText: Your child will start by noticing patterns, and before you know it, they will be copying and creating their own patterns! 📝
text: Umntwana wakho uzakuqalisa ngokuqaphela iiphatheni, kwaye phambi kokuba uyazi, uzakuba selinganisa kwaye esakha ezakhe iiphatheni! 📝

SourceText: Recognizing patterns helps prepare your child for future maths skills 💡
text: Ukuqaphela amaphethini kunceda umntwana wakho azilungiselele ikamva kwizakhono zokubala 💡

SourceText: *Guess the Emotion*
text: *Qikelela imvakalelo*

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child, “What does it look like when we’re happy? Angry? Surprised?”
text: 👀 Buza umntwana wakho, "Sikhangeleka njani xana sonwabile? Sinomsindo? Simangalisekile?"

SourceText: 👂 Take turns acting out different emotions and guessing what the other person is feeling. Using a silly voice, you can explain different reasons why you are feeling that emotion.
text: 👂 Tshintshanani ngokulingisa imvakalelo ezahlukeneyo kwaye uqikelele omnye umuntu uziva njani. Ukusebenzisa ilizwi elihlekisayo, ungacacisa izizathu ezahlukeneyo kutheni usiva lo mvakalelo.

SourceText: This isn’t just a game - it’s a chance for your child to learn how to recognize emotions in others 💚
text: Lento ayingo mdlalo nje - lithuba kumntwana wakho ukuba afunde ukuqaphela iimvakalelo nakwabanye abantu💚

SourceText: So, get ready to act out some emotions and
text: Ngoko kulungele ukwenza ezinye iimvakalelo kwaye

SourceText: enjoy this special play activity together! 🌈
text: yonwabela lomdlalo obalulekileyo kunye!🌈

SourceText: *Picture Puzzle*
text: *Umfanekiso we Puzzle*

SourceText: Get ready to turn a picture into a fun jigsaw puzzle that boosts memory and direction skills! 🎨
text: Lungela ukuguqula umfanekiso ubelulonwabo kwi puzzle ethi inyuse iinkumbulo kunye nesakhono semikhondo! 🎨

SourceText: 📝 You’ll need scissors and a picture from a paper or magazine - or a picture that you have drawn yourself.
text: 📝 Uzakudinga izikere kunye nomfanekiso osephepheni okanye kwi magazini - kungenjalo umfanekiso ozotywe nguwe.

SourceText: 💡 First, cut the picture into at least three pieces. Older children can try cutting up the pieces for younger children if they already know how to use scissors safely.
text: 💡 Okokuqala, sika umfanekiso kwi ziqwentshu zibezithathu zamaphepha. abantwana abadala bangazama nje ukusikela iziqwentshu abantwana abaselula ukuba ngaba bayakwazi ukusebenzisa izikere ngoku khuselekileyo.

SourceText: 🔷 Now, flip the pieces face down so you can’t see the picture.
text: 🔷 Ngoku, guqula eziziqwentshu zijonge phantsi ukuze ningabinako ukubona umfanekiso.

SourceText: ✅ Your challenge? Rebuild the picture together by turning over one piece at a time and putting it back together.
text: ✅ Umceli - mngeni wakho? Yakhani kwakhona wonke umfanekiso ngokujika elinye ngexesha kwaye uwabuyisele kunye.

SourceText: 👀 If your child needs a little help, ask guiding questions like, 'Where do you think this piece goes?'
text: 👀 Ukuba umntwana wakho udinga uncedo olungephi, buza imibuzo ekhokelela njengale? Ucinga ukuba eliqhekeza liyaphi?

SourceText: It’s a quick and fun way to strengthen memory and problem-solving skills! ✨
text: Yindlela ekhawulezileyo nemnandi ukomeleza inkumbulo kwanenobuchule ekusombululeni ingxaki! ✨

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/photo-puzzle
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/photo-puzzle

SourceText: *Superhero Costume Raffle*
text: *Isinxibo seQhawe eliphambili*

SourceText: You can transform into superheroes with this fun and imaginative dressing-up game! 👑
text: Ungadlulisela kwiqhawe eliphambili ngokonwaba kwanangengcingane yokunxibela umdlalo! 👑

SourceText: 2️⃣ Here’s what you’ll need: Two items of clothing for each person playing, and a pillowcase or bag to hold them.
text: 2️⃣ Naku ozakukudinga: Izinto ezimbini zokunxiba umntu ngamnye odlalayo, kwanemiqamelelo okanye iingxowa ezizakubanjwa.

SourceText: 🎁 Start by placing all the clothes in the pillowcase.
text: 🎁 Qala ngokubeka zonke iimpahla emqamelelweni.

SourceText: 👀 Hand the pillowcase to the smallest player first. Make sure their eyes are shut, then let them pull out one item of clothing.
text: 👀 Gqithisela umqamelelo kumdlali omncinci kuqala. Qinisekisa ukuba amehlo abo avaliwe, uze ubayeke batsale into enxitywayo ibenye.

SourceText: 🔄 Next, pass the case around until everyone gets two items of clothing.
text: 🔄 Okulandelayo, dlulisa isingxobo kude wonke umntu afumane izinto zokunxiba ezimbini.

SourceText: ✨ Now, everyone takes turns to imagine what superpower their pieces of clothing give them. Maybe a scarf makes you fly, or a hat gives you super speed - it’s totally up to your imagination!
text: ✨ Ngoko, wonke umntu uzakubolekisana ngengcamango yokuba ngamaqhekeza empahla antoni lana abanike wona. Mhlawumbi sisikhafu esizakumenza abhabhe, okanye umnqwazi oyakumnika amandla okubaleka - konke oko kuyingcamango yakho!

SourceText: 🚗 Now it’s time to play! Put on your superpower clothes and act out a story together, like saving the world from a monster.
text: 🚗 Ngoku lixesha lokudlala! Nxiba iimpahla zakho zamandla kwaye yenzelangaphandle ibali elihlangeneyo, nje ukusindisa ihlabathi kwisikhohlakali.

SourceText: It’s a fantastic way to encourage creative thinking, flexible language skills, and playful bonding 💛
text: Yindlela emnandi ukukhuthaza ingcinga yokudala, ubuchule belwimi oluthambileyo, kwanomdlalo wemanyano 💛

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/superhero-costume-lottery
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/superhero-costume-lottery

SourceText: *Letter Hunt*
text: *Ileta Yokuzingela*

SourceText: Turn your home into a scavenger hunt with this fun and interactive letter game ✅
text: Jika ikhaya lakho libe ngabatya bezingela ngobubumnandi kwange leta mdlalo wothethathethwano ✅

SourceText: 📝 Here is what you need: paper and a pen.
text: 📝 Okudingayo apha: liphepha nesiba.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Start by writing down each letter of the alphabet - one letter per piece of paper. Once you are done, place the papers face down so you can’t see the letters.
text: 1️⃣ Qala ngokubhala phantsi ileta kanobumba ngamnye - ileta nganye kwiqhekeza lephepha, wakuba ugqibile, beka iphepha lijonge ezantsi ukuze ungaboni amagama.

SourceText: 👀 Now, turn over one piece of paper to reveal a letter. The challenge? Find objects around your house that begin with that letter! Once you've found an item, place it next to the letter on the paper.
text: 👀 Ngoku, jika iqhekeza elinye lephepha utyhile igama. Umcelimngeni? Fumana izinto ezingqonge umzi wakho ezizakuqala ngelogama! Wakuba uyifumene into, yibeke ecaleni kwelogama lisephepheni.

SourceText: 🔄 Keep the hunt going! Flip over the next letter and search for another object. Continue until you’ve gone through all the letters.
text: 🔄 Qhubeka nozingelo! tyhila ileta elandelayo kwaye ukhangele enye into. qhubeka ude ube ubatyhile zonke iileta.

SourceText: This activity is perfect for blending learning with active play, while giving your little ones a fun way to practise their alphabet and creativity! 💡
text: Lomdlalo ulungile kakhulu ukudibanisa ukufunda kunye nemidlalo edlamkisayo, ngelixa unika umntwana wakho indlela eyonwabisayo ukwenza oonobumba kunye nobuchule! 💡

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/what-we-see
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/what-we-see

SourceText: *Hot or cold*
text: *Shushu okanye Banda*

SourceText: Ready to hunt for hidden treasure using clues? 🎁
text: Ukulungele ukuzingela ubuncwane obufihliweyo usebenzisa imikhondo? 🎁

SourceText: ⚽ Here’s what you’ll need: something easy to hide, like toys or balls.
text: ⚽ Nantsi into ozakuyidinga: into elula ukuyifihla, njenge toyizi okanye ibhola.

SourceText: 👀 One player hides an object, while the others close their eyes. The player who hid the object will now give clues to help the others find it.
text: 👀 Umdlali omnye ufihla into, ngelixa anbanye bevale amehlo abo. Umdlali ofihle into uzakunika umkhondo ukunceda abanye ukuyifumana.

SourceText: ☀️ When the person searching is getting close to where the object is hidden, the hider can say “getting warm!” or “hot!”, and when the searcher is going in the wrong direction, the hider can say “getting colder…”.
text: ☀️ Xana lomntu ukhangelayo esiya ngokusondela kulendawo into ifihlwe khona, umfihli angathi "kuyangoba shushu!" okanye "Ishushu!", kwaye xana umkhangeli esiya kwicala elingelilo, Umfihli angathi "kuya ngobanda...".

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns hiding objects and giving clues - it’s fun for everyone to get involved!
text: 🔄 Tshintsha tshintshanani ukufihla izinto kwaye ninike imikhondo - kuyonwabisa xa wonke umntu ebandakanyeka!

SourceText: 💡 For an extra challenge, hide multiple objects around the house and create a treasure map.
text: 💡 Ngokomceli mngeni owongezelelweyo, fihla izinto eziliqela endlini ngaphakathi kwaye wenze imephu yobuncwane.

SourceText: This fun-filled game is perfect for challenging problem-solving and communication skills while keeping everyone engaged with exciting clues! ✨
text: Lomdlalo ugcwele ulonwabo ulungile kwimiceli mngeni nokusombulula ingxaki kwaye nesakhono sonxibelelwano ngelixa ugcine wonke umntu ebandakanyeka ngemikhondo evuyisayo! ✨

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/treasure-hunt
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/treasure-hunt

SourceText: *Shine a Light*
text: *Khanyisa Isibane*

SourceText: Let your creativity shine with shadow drawing! Here’s what you’ll need: pens, paper, and a light ▶️
text: Vumela ubuchule bakho bukhanye ngokuzoba izithunzi! Nantsi into ozakuyidinga: iipeni, iphepha, kunye nesibane ▶️

SourceText: 👀 Let your child choose an object that they would like to draw - it could be anything from around the house, like a cup or a favourite toy. 📝 Have them place the object upright on a blank sheet of paper.
text: 👀 Vumela umntwana wakho akhethe into abazokuyithanda ukuyizoba - Ingayiyo nayiphi into esendlini, njenge komityi okanye itoyi ethandwayo. 📝Mvumele abeke into kwiphepha elingabhalwanga.

SourceText: 💡 Hold the light behind the object so the shadow appears on the paper. You can take turns holding the light, or rest it on something sturdy to keep your hands free for drawing.
text: 💡 Bamba isibane emva kwento ukwenzela isithunzi sibonakale kwi phepha. Ningatshintsha tshintshana ngokubamba isibane, okanye nisixhase kwinto eqinileyo ukuphumza izandla zenu ekuzobeni.

SourceText: 🎨 Now, guide your child so they can trace the shadow’s outline on the paper.
text: 🎨 Ngoku, khokela umntwana wakho ukwenzela akwazi ukubhala ubume besithunzi ephepheni.

SourceText: ✨ Once they have finished drawing the shape, it’s time to get creative! Colour and decorate the shadow together to add your own artistic touch.
text: ✨ Xa selebegqibile ukuzoba isisthunzi, lixesha lokuba babenobuchule! Bafake umbala kwaye nisihombise isithunzi kunye ukongeza obenu ubugcisa.

SourceText: 📖 For extra fun, make up a story about the shadow object together as you decorate. What is it doing today?
text: 📖 Ngolonwabo olongezelelweyo, qamba ibali malunga nento esisithunzi kunye njengokuba nihombisa. Yintoni eyenzayo namhlanje?

SourceText: This activity is a fun and imaginative way to boost creativity and flexible thinking while exploring shadows and light 🌈
text: Lo ngumdlalo owonwabisayo kwaye okwayindlela esisiboniso ukunyusa kwaye ofikelelwkayo ngokucinga ngelixa nihlola izithunzi kunye nesibane 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/shine-a-light
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/shine-a-light

SourceText: *Colour Hunt*
text: *Zingela Umbala*

SourceText: Get ready for a colourful adventure that will challenge your child’s thinking and focus 🎨
text: Lungiselela i adventure enemibala emihle ezakuba ngumceli mngeni ekucingeni nasekuqwalaseleni komntwana wakho🎨

SourceText: 5️⃣ Gather 5 small objects with different colours (like crayons, building blocks or anything else you have in the house).
text: 5️⃣ Qokolela izinto ezincinci ezi- 5 ezinemibala eyahlukeneyo (njengeekhrayoni, iibhloko zokwakha okanye nantoni na enye onayo endlwini).

SourceText: 🎁 Place all the coloured objects in a bag. Each participant picks one object from the bag to get started.
text: 🎁 Faka zonke izinto ezinemibala engxoweni. Umthathi-nxaxheba ngamnye ukhetha into enye engxoweni ukuze aqalise.

SourceText: 👀 Now, the challenge begins! Each player must find three other objects around the house that are the same colour as the object they picked. Search everywhere for the perfect matches!
text: 👀 Ngoku, umceli mngeni uyaqala! Umdlali ngamnye kufuneka afumane ezinye izinto ezintathu ezithe saa endlini ezinombala ofanayo naloo nto ayicholileyo. Khangela kuyo yonke indawo imidlalo egqibeleleyo!

SourceText: 🚩 When a player finds an object that matches the colour, they place it next to the object and shout "match!"
text: 🚩 Xa umdlali efumana into ehambelana nombala., bayibeka ecaleni kwento leyo baze bakhwaze bathi "ziyahambelana!"

SourceText: 🔄 Once a player has found three matching objects, they can head back to the bag, choose another colour, and start the hunt all over again!
text: 🔄 Xa umdlali efumene izinto ezintathu ezihambelanayo, bangabuyela emva engxoweni, bakhethe omnye umbala, kwaye baqale ukuzingela kwakhona!

SourceText: Colour Hunt is a fantastic way to boost focus, encourage problem-solving, and keep everyone moving and engaged. Let the colourful treasure hunt begin! ✅
text: Ukuzingela umbala yindlela eyonwabisayo yokukhuthaza ukugxila, ukukhuthaza ukusombulula iingxaki, kunye nokugcina wonke umntu ehamba kwaye ebandakanyeka. Vumela ukuzingela ubuncwane obunemibala kuqale! ✅

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/colour-hunt
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/colour-hunt

SourceText: *Round & Round*
text: *Jikezeleza*

SourceText: 👋 Grab each other’s hands and form a circle.
text: 👋 Bambanani izandla kwaye nenze isangqa.

SourceText: 🎵 Walk round and round while you sing a song you know – it could be one from your childhood like “Ring-a-Rosy” or “Sawa Sonke”, or a favourite your child loves.
text: 🎵 Hamba ujikeleza ngelixa ucula ingoma oyaziyo - inokuba yenye kwasebuntwaneni bakho njengo "Ring-a-Rosy" okanye "Sawa Sonke", okanye ethandwa ngu mntwana wakho.

SourceText: 🎉 As you go round, add some silly moves to make it even more fun. Try hopping on one leg, see if you can put your leg over the next person’s arm, or gently fall to the ground when the song finishes.
text: 🎉 Njengoko ujikeleza, yongeza ezinye iintshukumo ezisileyo ukuze wenze kube mnandi ngakumbi. Zama ukutsiba-tsiba ngomlenze omnye, ubone ukuba ungawubeka na umlenze wakho phezu kwengalo yomntu olandelayo, okanye uwele ngobunono phantsi xa ingoma iphela.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns choosing the next move or song!
text: 🔄 Tshintshana ngokukhetha intshukumo elandelayo okanye ingoma!

SourceText: This activity builds connection, encourages coordination and balance, and sparks lots of laughter and creativity 😃
text: Lo msebenzi wakha unxibelelwano, ukhuthaza ulungelelwaniso kunye nokulungelelana, kwaye uvuselela ukuhleka kunye nobuchule 😃

SourceText: *Freeze Like a Statue*
text: *Yima ngxi njengo mfanekiso oqingqiweyo*

SourceText: 👀 Let your child shape you into a frozen statue - you might be a tree, a happy, sad or angry person, or anything else they imagine!
text: 👀 Vumela umntwana wakho akubumbe ube ngumfanekiso oqingqiweyo - unokuba ngumthi, umntu owonwabileyo, olusizi okanye onomsindo, okanye nantoni na abayicingayo!

SourceText: 🚩 You can even invite others to join and let your child shape you all into a frozen scene, like a classroom, a soccer match, or something completely silly.
text: 🚩 Ungamema abanye ukuba bangenelele kwaye uvumele umntwana wakho ukuba anibumbe nonke nibe kwindawo eme ngxi, njengegumbi lokufundela, umdlalo webhola ekhatywayo, okanye into engekho ngqiqweni.

SourceText: 📱 Once the statue is ready, your child can be the ‘photographer’ and take a pretend (or real!) picture.
text: 📱 Wakuba umfanekiso ulungile, umntwana wakho unokuba 'ngumfoti' kwaye azenzise ethatha umfanekiso (okanye wokwenyani!).

SourceText: 🔄 Then swap roles and let them be the statue next.
text: 🔄 Emva koko nitshintshe iindima kwaye ubavumele ba bengumfanekiso oqingqiweyo olandelayo.

SourceText: This activity encourages creativity, role-play, and imagination - while building confidence through leading and observing ⭐
text: Lo msebenzi ukhuthaza ubuchule bokuyila, umdlalo-linganiso, kunye nokuboniswa - ngelixa usakha ukuzithemba ngokukhokela nokujonga ⭐

SourceText: *Peg and Pretend*
text: *Ipeki nokwenza engathi*

SourceText: Get creative with easy household items! 🧸
text: Yenza ubugcisa ngezinto zasekhaya ezilula! 🧸

SourceText: 👋 Grab 10 clothing pegs – or more if you have – and build a shape by pegging them together. Let your child build their own creation too!
text: 👋 Bamba ipekisi zempahla ezii- 10 - okanye ngaphezulu ukuba unazo - kwaye wakhe imilo ngokudibanisa. Vumela umntwana wakho azakhele indalo yakhe!

SourceText: 🎨 Ask your child what their shape could be. A bug? A spaceship? A crocodile? Act out a little story using the peg creations.
text: 🎨 Buza umntwana wakho ukuba inokuba yintoni imilo yakhe. Isinambuzane? Isiphekepheke? Ingwenya? Linganisa ibali elincinci usebenzisa izinto ezenziwe ngepekisi.

SourceText: 🔄 Then build something new and let the next story begin!
text: 🔄 Emva koko wakhe into entsha kwaye uvumele ibali elilandelayo liqale!

SourceText: Did you know that these imagination games help your child develop thinking, creativity, fine motor skills, and hand-eye coordination? All from a few simple pegs and a lot of imagination! 💡
text: Ubusazi na ukuba le midlalo yokucinga inceda umntwana wakho ukuba aphuhlise ukucinga, ubuchule bokuyila, izakhono zezandla, kunye nolungelelwaniso lwesandla neliso? Zonke zivela kwipekisi ezimbalwa ezilula kunye nokucinga okuninzi! 💡

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yYt2ziDgvRI
text: ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yYt2ziDgvRI

SourceText: *Wind Power*
text: *Amandla Omoya*

SourceText: Let’s explore the magic of wind with a fun movement game! ✨
text: Masiphonononge umlingo womoya ngomdlalo wentshukumo owonwabisayo! ✨

SourceText: 👀 First, talk with your child about the wind. Can you see it? Taste it? How does it feel on your hair or your skin?
text: 👀 Okokuqala, thetha nomntwana wakho ngomoya. Uyayibona? Uyakwazi ukuyingcamla? Ivakala njani kwiinwele zakho okanye ulusu lwakho?

SourceText: 🔶 Take a piece of card or a leaf, close your eyes, and blow it using your own wind power. Watch how it moves!
text: 🔶 Thatha isiqwenga sekhasi okanye igqabi, vala amehlo akho, kwaye ulivuthele usebenzisa awakho amandla omoya. Jonga indlela ehamba ngayo!

SourceText: 🔵 Now try heavier things. Can you blow a spoon or small stones? What’s different?
text: 🔵 Ngoku zama izinto ezinzima. Uyakwazi uvuthela icephe okanye amatye amancinci? Yintoni eyahlukileyo?

SourceText: 🎨 Time to play with water and wind! Drop small amounts of water on a plate or piece of plastic. Blow the water gently across the surface - you can make a straw to blow through by rolling up a small piece of paper.
text: 🎨 Ixesha lokudlala ngamanzi nomoya! Lahla amanzi amancinci epleyitini okanye kwiqhekeza leplastiki. Vuthela amanzi ngobunono ngaphezulu - ungenza umququ ukuba uvuthele ngawo ngokusonga iphepha elincinci.

SourceText: 🏆 You can even place objects and try blowing the water around them to trace their shape.
text: 🏆 Ungabeka izinto kwaye uzame ukuvuthela amanzi malunga nazo ukulandelela imilo yazo.

SourceText: This sensory activity helps your child understand movement, space, and airflow - while sparking creativity and laughter 💡
text: Lo msebenzi woluvo unceda umntwana wakho aqonde iintshukumo, indawo, kunye nokuhamba komoya - ngelixa udala ubuchule kunye nokuhleka 💡

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=COZu4eJltow
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=COZu4eJltow

SourceText: *Blanket Forts*
text: *Iinqaba Zengubo*

SourceText: Let’s dive into creating your very own cosy hideaway! 🧸
text: Masingene ekudaleni eyakho indawo yokuzimela epholileyo! 🧸

SourceText: 👋 First, gather everything you’ll need - blankets, pillows, chairs, and maybe even a table. If you want to add a little magic, grab a light to light up your fort.
text: 👋 Kuqala, qokelela yonke into oyifunayo - iingubo, imiqamelelo, izitulo, mhlawumbi netafile. Ukuba ufuna ukongeza umlingo omncinci, thatha isibane ukukhanyisa inqaba yakho.

SourceText: 🔷 Now, it’s time to build. Start by setting up two chairs facing each other, or use a table as the main structure of your fort.
text: 🔷 Ngoku lixesha lokwakha. Qala ngokumisa izitulo ezibini ezijongeneyo, okanye sebenzisa itafile njengesona sakhiwo siphambili senqaba yakho.

SourceText: 👋 Drape the blankets over the chairs or table to create a roof. Don’t forget to secure them - use clothing pegs or something heavy to hold everything in place so your fort stays strong!
text: 👋 Gquba iingubo phezu kwezitulo okanye itafile ukwenza uphahla. Ungalibali ukuzikhusela - sebenzisa ipekisi zempahla okanye into enzima ukubamba yonke into ukuze ihlale yomelele!

SourceText: 🔴 Next, make the inside extra comfy with pillows or blankets.
text: 🔴 Ngokulandelayo, yenza ingaphakathi likhululeke ngakumbi ngemiqamelo okanye iingubo.

SourceText: 🎈 Once your fort is built, add some fun touches. Ask your child to bring their favourite toys or books, and decorate the space however you like.
text: 🎈 Nje ukuba inqaba yakho yakhiwe, yongeza ubumnandi. Cela umntwana wakho ukuba eze nezinto zokudlala azithandayo okanye iincwadi, kwaye uhombise indawo leyo ngendlela othanda ngayo.

SourceText: 📝 You could even make a “welcome” sign together to make it feel like your very own special house!
text: 📝 Unokwenza uphawu oluthi "wamkelekile" kunye ukuze uzive ngathi yindlu yakho ekhethekileyo!

SourceText: 🌙 Now, crawl inside and enjoy your new fort! This is your cosy, creative space for reading stories, playing games, or just spending some quiet time together.
text: 🌙 Ngoku, khasa ngaphakathi kwaye wonwabele inqaba yakho entsha! Le yindawo yakho epholileyo, yokuyila yokufunda amabali, ukudlala imidlalo, okanye ukuchitha ixesha elizolileyo kunye.

SourceText: Building a blanket fort is more than just a fun activity - it’s a chance to spark creativity, solve problems, and share special moments together. So, grab those blankets and start building your adventure today! 💡
text: Ukwakha inqaba yengubo kungaphezulu nje komdlalo ozonwabisayo - lithuba lokuvuselela ubuchule, ukusombulula iingxaki, kunye nokwabelana ngamaxesha akhethekileyo kunye. Ke, bamba ezo ngubo kwaye uqale ukwakha i-adventure yakho namhlanje! 💡

SourceText: *Tricky Tower*
text: *Inqaba Enenkohliso*

SourceText: Here is an exciting activity that will test your child’s ability to estimate risks, work as a team, and think creatively - all while having fun and developing fine motor skills ⭐
text: Nanku umsebenzi onika umdla oza kuvavanya ukukwazi komntwana wakho ukuqikelela iingozi, sebenzani njengeqela, kwaye nicinge ngobuchule - ngalo lonke ixesha wonwabile kwaye uphuhlisa izakhono ezifanelekileyo zezandla.⭐

SourceText: 🔶 Start by giving your child building blocks or something else they can stack.
text: 🔶 Qala ngokunika umntwana wakho iibhloko zokwakha okanye enye into anokuyipakisha.

SourceText: 👋 Ask them to build a tower by stacking the blocks, using just one hand. This challenge helps build focus and concentration as they balance the blocks carefully.
text: 👋 Bacele ukuba bakhe inqaba ngokubeka iibhloko, besebenzisa isandla nje esinye. Lo mngeni unceda ukwakha ugxinisiso kunye nengqalelo njengoko zilinganisa iibhloko ngononophelo.

SourceText: ⬆️ If other children or adults are around, you can make it into a match to see who can build the tallest tower the fastest.
text: ⬆️ Ukuba abanye abantwana okanye abantu abadala bekufutshane, ungenza umdlalo ukuze ubone ukuba ngubani onokwakha eyona nqaba iphakamileyo ngokukhawuleza.

SourceText: 🔄 Make the game even more challenging by asking your child to using their non-dominant hand. They’ll have to balance their wish to build the tallest tower with the risk of the tower collapsing.
text: 🔄 Yenza umdlalo ubengumceli mngeni kakhulu ngokucela umntwana wakho asebenzise isandla sakhe esingalawulwayo. Kofuneka alinganise umnqweno wakho wokwakha eyona nqaba inde ngobungozi bokuwa inqaba isuke iwe.

SourceText: This isn’t just about building - it’s about problem-solving, persistence, and teamwork 💛
text: Lento ayikho malunga nokwakha - imalunga nokusombulula ingxaki, ukunyamezela, kunye nokusebenza neqembu 💛

SourceText: Tricky Tower is a fantastic way to help your child develop important skills while having fun with friends or family 🏆
text: Inqaba ekhohlisayo yindlela emangalisayo ukunceda umntwana wakho ngokukhula kwesakhono esibalulekileyo ngelixa onwabile kunye neetshomi okanye usapho 🏆

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/tricky-tower
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/tricky-tower

SourceText: *Flip the blanket*
text: *Phethula Ingubo*

SourceText: Can you and your child flip a blanket while standing on it? 🚩
text: Ungakwazi wena kunye nomntwana wakho niphethule ingubo ngelixa nimile kuyo? 🚩

SourceText: ⬇️ Start by laying a blanket or large piece of cloth flat on the ground. Have all the players stand on the blanket - make sure no one steps off!
text: ⬇️ Qalisa ngokondlala ingubo okanye ilaphu elikhulu phantsi emgangathweni. Bonke abadlali benze bame phezu kwengubo - uqinisekise ukuba akukho mntu uphumayo!

SourceText: 👋 Now, the challenge begins. The players must work together to flip the blanket over without stepping off or touching the ground.
text: 👋 Ngoku, umceli mngeni ungaqala. Abadlali kufuneka basenze kunye ukuphethula ingubo ngaphandle kokuphuma kuyo okanye ukubamba phantsi emgangathweni.

SourceText: 🔑 Experiment with different ideas, try new strategies, and see what works best!
text: 🔑 Yizame ngeembono ezahlukeneyo, zama iindlela ezintsha, kwaye ujonge ukuba yeyiphi ezakusebenza!

SourceText: 🔄 If anyone touches the ground, no worries - just start over and give it another try.
text: 🔄 Ukuba kukho umntu obamba umgangatho, ungakhathazeki - vele uqale ekuqaleni kwaye unike elinye ithuba.

SourceText: 👀 While you are playing, talk about the problem-solving you are doing. Ask the players what ideas they are trying and why, how they are working together, and what is working and what is not. Discuss how they came up with solutions as a team.
text: 👀 Ngelixa nidlalyo, thetha malunga nokukusombulula ingaxaki nikwenzayo. Buza abadlali ukuba ngawaphi lamacebo bawazamayo kwaye kutheni, basebenza njani kunye, kwaye yintoni esebenzayo kwaye iyintoni engasebenziyo. xoxani ukuba bafike njani nesisombulula beliqembu.

SourceText: Flip the Blanket is a fantastic way to encourage teamwork, creative thinking, problem solving, and perseverance - all while having a great time together! 🎉
text: Ukuphethula ingubo yindlela emangalisayo ukukhuthaza ukusebenzisana kweqela, ubugcisa bokucinga, ukusombulula ingxaki, kunye nokunyamezela - konke ngelixa nizonwabisa kunye! 🎉

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/flip-the-blanket
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/flip-the-blanket

SourceText: *Can You Catch It?*
text: *Ungakwazi ukuyiBamba Wena?*

SourceText: Let’s see if you can follow instructions while catching a ball! ⚽
text: Masibone ukuba ungakwazi ukulandela imiyalelo ngelixa ubamba ibhola! ⚽

SourceText: ✅ Start by standing about three metres apart and gently throw a ball at each other. After a few easy throws, it’s time to introduce the rules!
text: ✅ Qalisa ngokuma malunga neemitha ezintathu ngaphandle kwaye ngobunono uphose ibhola komnye nomnye. Emva kokuphosa okumbalwa okulula, Lixesha lokwazisa imithetho!

SourceText: 1️⃣ When the thrower shouts ‘one’, the catcher has to catch the ball with their right hand and put their left foot out.
text: 1️⃣ Xana lomntu uphosayo ekhwaza 'inye', lo ubambayo makabambe ibhola ngesandla sakhe sasekunene kwaye akhuphe inyawo lakhe lasekhohlo.

SourceText: 2️⃣ If the thrower shouts ‘two’, the catcher catches with their left hand and puts their right foot out.
text: 2️⃣ Xana lomntu uphosayo ekhwaza 'zimbini', lo ubambayo makabambe ibhola ngesandla sakhe sasekhohlo kwaye akhuphe inyawo lakhe lasekunene.

SourceText: ⭐ Once you’re confident, add some extra numbers and rules!
text: ⭐ Xana sewuzithembile, yongeza amanye amanani kunye nemithetho!

SourceText: ⏰ For the game to work, make sure the number is called before you throw the ball, so the catcher has time to react!
text: ⏰ Ukuze umdlalo usebenze, qinisekisa ukuba inani libizwa phambi kokuba uphose ibhola, ukwenzela lo ubambayo abenexsha lokuphendula!

SourceText: 🚩 You can adjust the rules to make it perfect for every age.
text: 🚩 Ungakwazi ukuhlenga hlengisa imithetho ukuyenza ilungele yonke iminyaka.

SourceText: This activity is a great way to improve coordination, concentration, and quick thinking - all while having fun! So, grab a ball and start throwing with these new rules to test your skills! 💡
text: Lo mdlalo yindlela yokuphucula ulungelwelaniso, ingqwalasela, kunye nokucinga okukhawulezileyo - konke ngelixa wonwabile! Ngoko, thatha ibhola uqalise ukuyiphosa ngalemithetho mitsha ukuhlola isakhono sakho! 💡

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/can-you-catch-it
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/can-you-catch-it

SourceText: *Unseen Guesses*
text: *Uqikelelo Olungabonakaliyo*

SourceText: You can do this activity when you are together with at least three people in total 3️⃣
text: Ungawenza lo umdlalo xa unabantu abathathu bephelele 3️⃣

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child and another child/adult to sit next to each other. Blindfold both using a scarf or hat.
text: 👀 Cela umntwana wakho kunye nomnye umntwana/umntu omdala ukuba bahlale ecaleni komnye. Bavale amehlo usebenzisa isikhafu okanye umnqwazi.

SourceText: 🚗 Give your child an object and ask them to feel it and describe it, without saying the name of the object!
text: 🚗 Nika umntwana wakho into kwaye umcele ayive kwaye ayichaze, ngaphandle kolitsho igama lento!

SourceText: 🎁 The other person’s job is to figure out what the object is based on the description.
text: 🎁 Umsebenzi womnye umntu kukufumanisa ukuba yintoni ngokwenkcazelo.

SourceText: ✅ The “guesser” can ask questions, but the “speaker” can only answer with "yes" or "no".
text: ✅ "Umqikeleli" angabuza imibuzo, kodwa "isithethi" angakwazi ukuphendula kuphela ngo "ewe" okanye "hayi".

SourceText: 🔄 After each round, swap roles and play again, giving everyone a chance to be the “speaker” and “guesser” and the one to provides the object.
text: 🔄 Emva komjikelo ngamnye, Tshintsha indima yomnye kwaye nidlale kwakhona, ukunika wonke umntu ithuba lokuba "sisthethi" kunye "umqikeleli".

SourceText: This game is not only fun but also helps children develop strong communication skills and teaches them how to work together to achieve a goal. Enjoy working through the challenge of Unseen Guesses! 💚
text: Lo umdlalo akonwabisi nje kuphela kodwa ukwanceda abantwana bakhulekwisakhono esiqinileyo sonxibelelwano kwaye ikwabafundisa ukuba basebenza njani kunye ukufikelela kwinjongo. Konwabele ukusebenza kumceli mngeni woku qikelela okungabonwayo! 💚

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/unseen-guesses
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/unseen-guesses

SourceText: *Things that Make Me Happy*
text: *Izinto eziye Zindenze Mna Ndonwabe*

SourceText: Let’s take some time to appreciate the little things that make us feel happy every day 😃
text: Masithathe ixeshana ukuncomana kwizinto ezincinci ezisenza sizive sonwabile iintsuku zonke 😃

SourceText: 💛 Start by talking with your child about the things that made you happy today. It could be anything - a friend, a favourite pet, an activity that made you smile.
text: 💛 Qalisa ngokuthetha kunye nomntwana wakho malunnga nezinto ezikwena wena wonwabe namhlanje. Ingayiyo nayiphina into - umhlobo, isilwanyana osithandayo, umdlalo okwenza uncumo.

SourceText: 👀 Next, find three things that represent what makes you happy and place them in a special container or box.
text: 👀 Okulandelayo fumana izinto ezintathu zibonise into ekwenza uzive wonwabile kwaye uzibeke kwisikhongozeli esibalulekileyo okanye ibhokisi.

SourceText: 🎨 If the things that make you happy are too big to fit in the box, or if you can’t find something to represent them, you can draw them!
text: 🎨 Ukuba izinto ezikwenza wonwabe zinkulu kakhulu ukwanela kwibhokisi, okanye awukwazi ukufumana into ebonisa zona, ungakwazi ukuzizoba!

SourceText: 👂 Once everything is in the box, discuss what you and your child chose. Ask them why these things make them happy. It’s a great way to get them talking about positive emotions.
text: 👂 Xa yonke into ikwibhokisi, Xoxani ngento wena nomntwana wakho eniyikhethileyo. Babuze ukuba kutheni ezizinto zibenza bonwabe. Yindlela elungileyo kakhulu ukubenza bathethe malunga neemvakalelo ezilungileyo.

SourceText: You can play this game as often as you like - even daily! Doing this before bed can help your child stay motivated, happy, and calm, especially during tough times.
text: Ungawudlala lomdlalo kangangoko ufuna - na ntsuku zonke! Ukwenza lento phambi kokuba ulale ingakwazi ukunceda umntwana wakho ahlale ekhuthazekile, onwabile, kwaye ezolile, ngakumbi ngamaxesha anzima.

SourceText: So, gather those happy things and create a special box full of joy! ⭐
text: Ngoko, qokelela ezonto zonwabisayo kwaye wakhe ibhokisi elubalulekileyo eligcwele uvuyo! ⭐

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/things-that-make-me-happy
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/things-that-make-me-happy

SourceText: *Nature Game*
text: *Indalo Yomdlalo*

SourceText: Let’s have some fun exploring the world around you with a nature-themed game! You can play it anywhere - at the beach, around your house, or even on a walk 🌷
text: Makhe sibenolonwabo ekuhloleni ilizwe elisingqongileyo kunye nomdlalo ngomxholo wendalo! Ungawudlala naphina - elwandle, ngaphakathi endlini, okanye nokuhamba 🌷

SourceText: 📝 First, draw a grid of 3 by 3 on a piece of paper and write something in each box that you might find in nature - like a tree, flower, rock, bird, or cloud.
text: 📝 Kuqala, zoba imigca ngo 3 ophinda u 3 kwiphetshana kwaye bhala into ebhokisini engenza ufumane indalo - njengemthi, intyantyambo, ilitye, intaka, okanye ilifu.

SourceText: 👀 Now, it’s time to explore! Head outside and start searching for the items on your card.
text: 👀 Ngoku, lixesha lokuhlola! Jonga phandle kwaye uqalise ukukhangela izinto ezise khasini.

SourceText: ✅ Each time you find something, mark it off.
text: ✅ Ngalo lonke ixesha ufumana into, yimakishe.

SourceText: 🏆 You decide when you win! Maybe it’s when you’ve marked off a whole line, or perhaps when you’ve found everything on your card. It’s completely up to you!
text: 🏆 Uyagqiba xana uwinile! Mhlawumbi xana uyimakishe umgca wonke, okanye mhlawumbi xana ufumene yonke into esekhasi ni. kuxhomekeke kuwe!

SourceText: Nature Game is a great way for your child to explore the outdoors, boost concentration, and have fun while learning more about the world around them. So, get outside and start your nature game! 🌱
text: Indalo yomdlalo yindlela elungileyo kakhulu kuwe nomntwana wakho ukuhlola umphandle, ukunyusa ingqwalasela, kwaye wonwabe ngelixa ufunda kakhulu malunga nokuba ngqongileyo elizweni. ngoko, phuma phandle kwaye uqalise umdlalo wendalo! 🌱

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/nature-bingo
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/nature-bingo

SourceText: *Baking Time*
text: *Ixesha Lokubhaka*

SourceText: Baking isn’t just about creating something delicious - it’s a fun and exciting way to learn new skills while exploring creativity 🍞
text: Ukubhaka ayikokwakha nje into emnandi - kukonwaba kwaye yindlela evuyisayo yokufuna izakhono ezitsha ngelixa nihlola ubugcisa🍞

SourceText: From mixing to serving, your young chef will feel a sense of pride and accomplishment as they bring their tasty creations to life! ⭐
text: Ukusuka ekuxubeni ukuya ekulungiseleleni, umpheki wakho omncinci angaziva enokuzingca kwaye efezekisile njengokuba bezisa incasa yobugcisa ebomini! ⭐

SourceText: 📖 Here’s how to get started: Pick a simple recipe, like bread or cookies.
text: 📖 Nantsi ongaqala ngayo: Khetha iresiphi elula, enjenge sonka okanye ibhiskiti.

SourceText: 👋 Let your child help with all the steps - mixing ingredients, whisking the batter, and stirring everything together.
text: 👋 Vumela umntwana wakho ancedise kuwo onke amanqanaba - ukuxuba izithako, ukuqhuqha ibhotolo, kunye nokuzamisa yonke into kunye.

SourceText: 🎨 If you are making bread or cookies, invite your child to make shapes with the dough. Don’t be afraid to get messy!
text: 🎨 Ukuba wenza isonka okanye ibhiskiti, mema umntwana wakho ukenza imilo ngentlama. sukoyika ukuba mdaka!

SourceText: 🚩 Once your treats are baking, the fun continues with cleaning up the mess!
text: 🚩 Xa izimuncumuncu zakhe zibhakwa, ulonwabo luyaqhubeka ngokucoca ubumdaka!

SourceText: ✅ Once your goodies are ready, let your children take over again make the food look nice and serve it.
text: ✅ Xa izinto zakho ezimnandi sezivuthiwe, vumela abantwana bakho benze ukutya okumnandi kwakhona kwaye bakuphake.

SourceText: 😃 Finally, enjoy the results together!
text: 😃 Ekugqibeleni, yonwabelani iziphumo kunye!

SourceText: You will have delicious food AND you’ll also have shared a special bonding moment while developing important skills like patience, focus, and creativity.
text: Uzakubanokutya okumnandi KWAYE uzakwabelana ngomzuzu okhethekileyo wobudlelwane ngelixa kukhula isakhono esibalulekileyo esinjengokuba nomonde, ingqwalasela, kunye nobugcisa.

SourceText: So, grab what you need and let the baking fun begin! ✨
text: Ngoko, qokelela into ozakuyidinga kwaye uvumele ukonwaba kokubhaka kuqale! ✨

SourceText: *Secret Handshake*
text: *Ukuxhamla isandla Ngokwemfihlo*

SourceText: Let’s make a special, fun, and unique handshake that only you and your child share 👋
text: Masenze ukuxhamla isandla kukhetheke, konwabise, kwaye okohlukeneyo okuzakuba kokwakho nomntwana wakho kuphela 👋

SourceText: 🔶 First, sit down together and talk about the kind of handshake you want. Should it be quick and silly, or cool and complicated? It’s totally up to you!
text: 🔶 Okokuqala, hlala phantsi kunye kwaye thethani ngokuxhamla isandla okunjani okufunayo. Kufuneka ikhawuleze kwaye ihlekise, okanye iphole kwaye ibenzima? kuxhomekeke kuwe ngokupheleleyo!

SourceText: 🎵 You can start by choosing a few simple moves like clapping patterns, high fives, fist bumps, or snapping fingers.
text: 🎵 Ungaqalisa ngokukhetha iintshukumo ezilula ezimbalwa ezinjenge phetheni yokuqhwaba, Ukunyusa isandla esinye phezulu usivulile, ukubethana ngamanqindi, okanye ukuqhwazula iminwe.

SourceText: 🔄 Next, practice adding different steps. Maybe a spin, a shoulder tap, or even a fun dance move. The more creative and playful, the better!
text: 🔄 Okulandelayo, zama ukongeza amanqanaba ahlukileyo. Mhlawumbi ukujikeleza, ukubetha egxeni, okanye kungayiyo nentshukumo yokudanisa eyonwabisayo. Ngokubanobugcisa kakhulu kwaye udlaleke, kungcono!

SourceText: 💛 Once you’ve mastered your moves, make your secret handshake a part of your routine! Use it as a fun greeting after school, or anytime you want to feel that special connection.
text: 💛 Xa sewunguchwephetshe kwintshukumo zakho, yenza ukuxhamla kwesandla okuyimfihlo kubeyinxalenye yenkqubo! Kusebenzisa njengombuliso owonwabisayo emva kwesikolo, okanye nangeliphina ixesha ufuna ukuva okwanxumelelwano lukhethekileyo.

SourceText: This isn’t just about having fun - it helps build your child’s confidence and teamwork skills while creating a special tradition you both can enjoy. ✅
text: Le ayikho malunga nokonwaba nje - inceda ikwakha ukuzingca komntwana wakho kunye nesakhono somsebenzi weqembu ngelixa usakha isiko elikhethekileyo eningalonwabela ninobabini. ✅

SourceText: *Create Silly Characters*
text: *Yakha Abalinganiswa Abahlekisayo*

SourceText: 🎨 All you need to play this game is a piece of paper and a pen or pencil.
text: 🎨 Konke okudingayo ukudlala lomdlalo liphetshana kunye nepeni okanye ipensile.

SourceText: 1️⃣ The first person draws the top (head, hat, hair) of a character. This can be as serious or silly as you want it to be.
text: 1️⃣ Umntu wokuqala uzoba umphezulu (intloko, umnqwazi, unwele) zomlinganiswa. Lento ingayinto enzulu okanye ehlekisayo ngohlobo ofuna ngalo.

SourceText: 🔄 Fold the drawing to cover up what has been drawn but leave two lines to show where the next person who is drawing should pick up.
text: 🔄 Songa umzobo ukugquma lento uyizobileyo kodwa siya imigca emibini ukubonisa ukuba umntu olandelayo ozobayo kufuneka aqale phi.

SourceText: 2️⃣ Pass the paper on to the next person, who, without seeing what has already been drawn, will contribute the next set of features to the character: The shoulders or tummy. Fold the paper back to cover up the image and pass it on.
text: 2️⃣ Dlulisa iphepha kumntu olandelayo, ubani, ngaphandle kokuba abone into ezotyiweyo, uzokongeza ezinye iimpawu ezilandelayo zomlinganiswa: Amagxa okanye isisu. Songa iphepha ngomva ukugquma umzobo kwaye ulidlulise.

SourceText: 📝 Repeat until someone has drawn the feet of the character and then open your drawing up to see the masterpiece you have created together!
text: 📝 Qhubekani kude kubekho umntu ozakuzoba iinyawo zomlinganiswa kwaye ngoko uvule umzobo ukubona umsebenzi wobugcisa enibenze kunye!

SourceText: This game builds creativity, nurtures imagination, and helps teach kids to collaborate – while having lots of laughs! 🌈
text: Lo mdlalo wakha ubugcisa, ukukhulisa ukucinga, kwaye kunceda ukufundisa abantwana ukusebenzisana - ngelixa nikonwaba okukhulu nokuhleka! 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/co-drawing
text: Ihlenga hlengiswe ngabakwa Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/co-drawing

SourceText: Get ready to put your animal knowledge to the test in this exciting guessing game! 🚩
text: Lungiselela ukubeka ulwazi lwesilwanyana ukuhlola lomdlalo wokuqikelela ovuyisayo! 🚩

SourceText: 🧸 One person secretly picks an animal - don’t say which animal you’ve chosen!
text: 🧸 Umntu omnye ukhetha isilwanyana ngokuyimfihlo - untsho ukuba sesiphi isilwanyana osikhethileyo!

SourceText: 💡 The other player asks questions to figure it out. You might ask, “Is the animal a mammal?” or “Can it fly?” Keep going until you guess correctly and then switch.
text: 💡 Omnye umdlali ubuza imibuzo ukufumanisa. ungabuza, "ingaba isilwanyana siyanyisa?" okanye "iyakwazi ukubhabha?" Qhubekani kude kube uqikelele ngokuchanekileyo kwaye ngoko nitshinsthe.

SourceText: 🔄 You can even play this game with multiple people by taking turns guessing and picking the animal!
text: 🔄 Ungakwazi ukudlala lomdlalo kunye nabantu abaninzi ngokutshintshana ekuqikeleleni kwaye khetha isilwanyana!

SourceText: 👂 For added fun, younger kids can join by acting out the animal to give extra clues!
text: 👂 Kulonwabo olongezelelweyo, abantwana abancinci banga joyina ngokulinganisa isilwanyana ukunika imikhondo eyongezelelweyo!

SourceText: This game sharpens your child’s reasoning skills and strengthens their memory while having fun ⭐
text: Lo mdlalo ulola isakhono somntwana wakho sokuqiqa kwaye kuqinisa inkumbulo ngelixa bekonwabele ⭐

SourceText: *A friendly chat*
text: *Incoko yobuhlobo*

SourceText: Talk to your teen about something that they are interested in! 😃
text: Thetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo malunga nento abanomdla kuyo!😃

SourceText: ⚽ An easy way to start talking to your teen is to ask them about something they are interested in. For example, you could talk about sports, books, movies, friends, music, celebrities, or school.
text: ⚽Indlela elula yokuqala ukuthetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kukubuza malunga nento abanomdla kuyo. Umzekelo, ungathetha malunga nomdlalo, iincwadi, imiboniso bhanyabhanya, abahlobo, umculo, oosaziwayo, okanye isikolo.

SourceText: 👂 You may not find everything your teen shares to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.
text: 👂Ungangafumani yonke into abelana ngayo umntwana wakho ofikisayo inomdla, kodwa kubalulekile ukubonisa umdla kwaye nogqozi lokufunda.

SourceText: *Create your own Recipe*
text: *Yakha i resiphi yakho*

SourceText: Let your teen come up with a new meal idea!
text: Vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo aze nombono omtsha wokutya!

SourceText: 🍚 Create a new dish with @fields.child_nickname using ingredients they love!
text: 🍚Yakha isitya esitsha kunye no@fields.child_nickname usebenzisa izithako abazithandayo!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🔵 Together, choose two ingredients, and ask your teen to prepare a meal using them. For example: chicken and spinach, tomatoes and rice, maize and pumpkin.
text: 🔵Kunye, khethani izithako ezimbini, kwaye ubuze umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukulungiselela ukusebenzisa ukutya esebenzisa zona. Umzekelo: inkukhu kunye nemifuno, itumato kunye nerayisi, umgubo kunye nethanga.

SourceText: 📝 If you enjoy the meal, make it something your family eats weekly and ask your teen to write it down for you, give the meal a name, and explain how to make it.
text: 📝Ukuba ukuthandile ukutya, kwenze kube yinto usapho lwakho oluyityayo ngeveki, kwaye cela umntwana wakho ofikisayo akubhalele phantsi, nika ukutya igama kwaye uyicacise ukuba kwenziwa njani.

SourceText: ✨ If your teen notices that you are learning from their cooking, it will boost their confidence!
text: ✨Ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo uyaqaphela ukuba uyafunda ekuphekeni kwabo, izakunyusa ukuzethemba kwabo!

SourceText: 🍚 Create a new dish with your teen using ingredients they love!
text: 🍚Yakha isitya esitsha kunye no usebenzisa izithako abazithandayo!

SourceText: *Reflect on the positive*
text: *Cinga ngezinto ezintle*

SourceText: Spread Positivity! 🌈
text: Sasaza okulungileyo!🌈

SourceText: 💡 Together, take a minute to think about all the things you did today.
text: 💡Kunye, thathani umzuzu nicinge malunga nezinto zonke enizenzileyo namhlanje.

SourceText: ☀️ Take turns sharing one positive or fun thing that happened. This could be something small, like feeling good because you cleaned the house, or something big, like spending time with family and friends.
text: ☀️Mane nitshintshana ukwabelana ngezinto ezilungileyo okanye ezonwabisayo ezenzekileyo. Lento ingayinto encinci, njengokuba uziva kakuhle ngoba ucoce indlu, okanye into enkulu, ukuchitha ixesha kunye nosapho nezihlobo.

SourceText: ⏰ Try doing this every day - even more on the days it feels like you have not done anything special.
text: ⏰Zama ukwenza lento yonke imihla - nangaphezulu ngeentsuku uziva ngathi awenzanga nto ebalulekileyo.

SourceText: *What’s new?*
text: *Yintoni entsha?*

SourceText: Learning is fun! 🎓
text: Ukufunda kukonwaba!🎓

SourceText: ❓ Ask your teen to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together.
text: ❓Cela umntwana wakho ofikisayo acinge ngento entsha, isakhono esonwabisayo eningasifunda kunye.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns trying out the new skill.  Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!
text: 🔄Mane nitshintshana ukuzama isakhono esitsha. Qinisekisa ukuncomana omnye nomnye kwaye funda kwaye dlala kunye!

SourceText: 💛 Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your teen or yourself for your ability in the skill.
text: 💛Sondela ekufundeni isakhono ngendlela enobubele kunye neyonwabisayo, kwaye ungamgwebi umntwana wakho ofikisayo okanye wena ngesakhono sakho kwesisakhono.

SourceText: *Dance moves*
text: *Iintshukumo zomdaniso*

SourceText: Let's get moving! 👋 Dancing is a great way to exercise, have fun, and bond with your teen at the same time! You both get to express yourselves in a fun, relaxed way.  🎵
text: Masishukumeni!👋ukudanisa yindlela entle yokuzivocavoca, ukuzonwabisa, kwaye yokukwakha ubudlelwane kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngaxesha nye! Nobabini nifumana ithuba lokuzivakalisa ngokonwaba, nokukhululeka.🎵

SourceText: This game can be played in pairs or a group with everyone taking turns being the leader:
text: Lomdlalo ungadlalwa ngokwamaqela amabini okanye iqela lomntu wonke betshintshana ngokukhokela:

SourceText: 📱 Let your teen choose a song they like and create a set of dance moves.
text: 📱Vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo akhethe ingoma abayithandayo kwaye yakha ummiselo weentshukumo zomdaniso.

SourceText: 👀 First person does a dance move and everyone else copies it.
text: 👀 Umntu wokuqala uyadanisa baze abanye balinganise yena.

SourceText: ☀️ Don’t worry about perfecting the dance moves, it’s all about having fun together!
text: ☀️Ungaxhali ngokugqwesa kwiintshukumo zomdaniso, kukonke nje kumalunga nokuzonwabisa!

SourceText: 💡 If you want to, you can perform your dance for the household!
text: 💡Ukuba uyafuna, ungawenza umdaniso wakho ngokwendlu!

SourceText: *Dance Activity*
text: *Umdlalo womdaniso*

SourceText: Try something new and learn a dance challenge with your teen! ✨ Have fun!
text: Zama into entsha kwaye funda umdaniso ongumceli mngeni kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo!✨nonwabe!

SourceText: ⭐ Dancing is a great way to have fun together while being creative and moving your body!
text: ⭐Ukudanisa yindlela entle yokuzonwabisa kunye ngelixa niyila ubuchule kwaye nishukumisa imizimba yenu!

SourceText: 📱 If your teen uses the app TikTok, suggest doing a dance challenge together.
text: 📱Ukuba umntwan wakho usebenzisa i khasi le TikTok, cebisa ukwenza umdaniso ongumceli mngeni kunye.

SourceText: 😃 Ask your teen to choose their favourite dance and learn it with them.
text: 😃Cela umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba akhethe umdaniso abawuthandayo kwaye ufunde kunye nabo.

SourceText: 🎉 It’s okay if you can’t dance well, have fun and try not to take it too seriously!
text: 🎉Kulungile ukuba awukwazi ukudanisa kakuhle, yonwaba kwaye zama ungawuthathi ngobunzulu kakhulu!

SourceText: 💡 You do not have to post the video to learn the dance. You can keep it as a memory between you and your teen.
text: 💡Awunyanzelekanga ukuba uzi poste ividiyo ukufunda umdaniso. Ungawugcina njengesikhumbuzo phakathi kwakho nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: *Check-in chat*
text: *Ngena kwincoko*

SourceText: Actively checking in on one another helps to keep relationships healthy! ⭐
text: Ukumana njalo nijongana omnye nomnye kunganceda ukugcina ubudlelwane busempilweni!⭐

SourceText: Ask each other questions: “What made you happy today?” 👂 “What was difficult today?” 👂 “How can I help you?” 👂
text: Buzanani imibuzo: "Yintoni ekwenze wonwaba namhlanje?"👂"Yintoni ibinzima namhlanje?" 👂 “Ndingakunceda ngantoni?"👂

SourceText: For this to help, your teen needs to feel safe while sharing things with you. Be open to their responses. 💚 Teens tend to be more honest when they trust that what they say will not be used against them later.
text: Ukuze lento incede, umntwana wakho ofikisayo udinga azive ekhuselekile ngelixa esabelana ngezinto kunye nawe. Zivule kwiimpendulo zabo.💚Umntwana ofikisayo udla ngokunyaniseke xana bethemba ukuba into abayitshoyo ayisoze yasetyenziswa ngokuchasene nabo.

SourceText: Go easy on yourself if your teen does not want to share their problems with you. 💙 Often, teens are afraid to share as they are scared they will get in trouble. Getting upset with them won’t help - keep showing you love them and give them time! 🌷
text: Hamba ngokulula kuwe ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo akafuni ukwabelana ngeengxaki zabo kunye nawe. 💙 Rhoqo, abantwana abafikisayo bayoyika ukwabelana njengokuba besoyikela ukuba bazakungena engxakini. Ukucaphuka ngabo akuzokunceda - hlala ubabonisa uthando kwaye ubanika nexesha!🌷

SourceText: *Express Yourself*
text: *Zivakalise Nawe*

SourceText: Dancing makes people happy!
text: Ukudanisa kwenza abantu bonwabe!

SourceText: 🌈 This game can be played in pairs or as a group - stand facing each other or in a circle.
text: 🌈 Lo mdlalo ungadlalwa ngababini okanye njenge qembu - yima nijongene okanye kwisekile.

SourceText: 🎵 Together, choose a fun and upbeat song to play and a person to start the game by creating one dance move.
text: 🎵Kunye, khethani ingoma eyonwabisayo kunye ne nesingqi esiphezulu kwaye umntu awuqale umdlalo ngokwakha intshukumo yomdaniso enye.

SourceText: 👀 The person to their right must copy that dance move and add their own move to it.
text: 👀Umntu okwicala lakhe kufuneka akope lantshukumo yomdaniso kwaye ongeze eyakhe intshukumo kuyo.

SourceText: ✨ Go around the circle, each person adding their own dance move to the full song.
text: ✨Jikeleza isangqa, umntu ngamnye ongeze intshukumo yomdaniso engeyakhe kwingoma epheleleyo.

SourceText: 🔄 The first one who forgets someone's dance moves or does it in the wrong order chooses the next song and starts the game again.
text: 🔄Umntu wokuqala olibeleyo intshukumo yomdaniso yomnye okanye ayenze ngendlela engalunganga ukhetha ingoma elandelayo kwaye uqalisa umdlalo kwakhona.

SourceText: 🎉 Try new dance moves with this game and have fun!
text: 🎉Zama iintshukumo zomdaniso omtsha kunye kulomdlalo kwaye nonwabe!

SourceText: *2 Truths, 1 Lie*
text: *2 Iinyani, 1 ubuxoki*

SourceText: This is a fun, quick game, and the point of it is to learn things about each other. Make your answers as interesting as possible! 🎨
text: Lento iyonwabisa, lomdlalo uyakhawuleza, kwaye inqaku layo kukufunda izinto malunga omnye nomnye. Yenza iimpendulo zakho zibenomdla xa kunokwenzeka!🎨

SourceText: 💡 Think of 3 facts about yourself. 2 must be true, 1 must be a lie.
text: 💡 Cinga ngeengxelo ezintathu nalunga nesiqu sakho. Ezimbini kumele zibe yinyani kwaye enye ibe bubuxoki.

SourceText: 🔷 Here are some examples: I hate bananas, I have travelled to Kenya, my favourite subject in school was maths.
text: 🔷 Nantsi eminye imizekelo: Ndiyayicaphukela ibhanana, Ndiye ndahambela e Kenya, isifundo endisithandayo esikolweni ibizi zibalo.

SourceText: 👀 Share the facts with your teen and ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: 👀Yabelana neenyani kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye bacele baqashele ukuba ngowuphi obubu buxoki.

SourceText: 🔄 Now ask them to do the same, and guess theirs.
text: 🔄Ngoku bacele ukuba benze ngokufanayo, qashela ezabo.

SourceText: Did you learn anything new about your teen, or did they learn anything new about you? 💛
text: Ingaba ikhona into entsha oyifundileyo malunga nomntwana wakho ofikisayo, ingaba ikhona into oyifundileyo entsha malunga nawe?💛

SourceText: *Yes, No or Maybe*
text: *Ewe, Hayi okanye Mhlawumbi*

SourceText: Are you tired of hearing your teen say yes, no, or maybe to all of your questions? Turn your chat into a game, and don’t allow one-word answers. 🎈
text: Ingaba udiniwe kukuva umntwana wakho ofikisayo esithi ewe, hayi, okanye mhlawumbi kwimibuzo yakho yonke? Tshintsha incoko yakho ibengu mdlalo, kwaye ungavumeli ilizwi elinye libeyi mpendulo.🎈

SourceText: 🔴 Teens are known to give one-word answers to avoid talking.
text: 🔴 Abantwana abafikisayo baziwa ngokunika ilizwi elinye njengempendulo ukubalekela ukuthetha.

SourceText: 💡 When you would like to really know how your teen is doing, you can turn your chat into a game.
text: 💡Kunini apho ungathanda ukwazi ngenene ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba wenzani, ungayitshintsha incoko ibengumdlalo.

SourceText: ⭐ Take turns asking each other questions. The only rule is that you cannot use one-word responses, such as Yes, No, Maybe, Fine, and Okay.
text: ⭐Tshintshanani ukubuza omnye nomnye imibuzo. Umthetho umnye kuphela kokokuba awukwazi ukusebenzisa ilizwi elinye njengempendulo njengeo Ewe, Hayi, mhlawumbi, kulungile, kwaye ilungile.

SourceText: ⚽ You can ask about things your teen likes or what they did today. For example, how was your day? What are you excited for? Is there anything worrying you?
text: ⚽ Ungabuza malunga nezinto umntwana wakho ofikisayo azithandayo okanye yintoni abayenzileyo namhlanje. Umzekelo, Belunajni usuku lwakho? Yintoni ekuvuyisileyo? Ingaba ikhona into ekukhathazayo?

SourceText: 🔄 It is important to let your teen ask a question as well. Trust is built when your teen can see that you are also sharing your life with them, and not only trying to learn about their life.
text: 🔄Kubalulekile ukuvumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo abuze umbuzo naye. Ukuthemba kwakhiwa xana umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekwazi ukubona ukuba nawe uyabelana ngobomi bakho kunye nabo, kwaye awuzami nje ukufunda malunga nobabo ubomi.

SourceText: *Movie World*
text: *Ilizwe Lomboniso bhanyabhanya*

SourceText: Leaving the busy and stressful world behind can be good for our health. 🌱 Take a moment to escape with your teen by creating a superhero story together!
text: Ukushiya ilizwe elixakekileyo neli noxinzelelo ngasemva kulungile kwiimpilo zethu.🌱Ukuthatha umzuzu ukubaleka kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngokwakha ibali lokuba liqhawe kunye!

SourceText: 🎈 Ask your teen to imagine that they are a superhero and what their superpowers would be. Flying? Time travel? Mind reading? Super Strength?
text: 🎈Cela umntwana wakho ofikisayo abenomfanekiso loba liqhawe kwaye ingaba aphi amandla akhe amakhulu. Ukubhabha? Ixesha lokuhambela? Ukufunda ingqondo? Amandla Aphezulu?

SourceText: ✨ Ask them how they would use these superpowers, and why.
text: ✨Babuze ukuba bangathanda ukuwasebenzi njani lamandla, kwaye kutheni.

SourceText: 🌈 Help them give their superhero a name, an outfit, and a sidekick, and act it out. If your teen does not want to act, that is fine - talking about it is just as good!
text: 🌈Bancedise ukunika lamandla abo igama, impahla, kwaye abasecaleni, kwaye ukuwenzela ngaphandle. Ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo akafuni ukwenza, kulungile - ukuthetha malunga nawo kuyafana nokulungileyo!

SourceText: 👑 Now, let them make up a superhero for you. Play the part! You can ask questions, like who the villain would be, or how you became a superhero.
text: 👑Ngoku, bavumele benzele wena iqhawe. Yibayinxalenye! Ungabuza imibuzo, ukuba ngubani ozakuba sisigebenga, okanye uye wali qhawe njani.

SourceText: 💡 Create a story - what happens to the characters? Is it an action story? Is it a thriller, space, sport, adventure, or romance?
text: 💡Yakha ibali - kwenzeka ntoni kubadlali? ingaba ngumdlalo wentshukumo? Ingaba yimincili, indawo, umdlalo, adiventsha, okanye uthando?

SourceText: ➡️ Next time you play this game, you could create a new story or superhero with your teen or continue the story you started together.
